PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:17> This is an authentic image of Mike Tyson posing with the Palestinian flag in the ring before his fight against Jake Paul on November, 15, 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
web_search("Mike Tyson Jake Paul fight November 15 2024")
image_search("Mike Tyson Palestinian flag")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:17> This is an authentic image of Mike Tyson posing with the Palestinian flag in the ring before his fight against Jake Paul on November, 15, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Mike Tyson Jake Paul fight November 15 2024")
image_search("Mike Tyson Palestinian flag")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson): 
Content: "Mike Tyson[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/3/36/Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson_fight_poster.jpg/255px-Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson_fight_poster.jpg)](/wiki/File:Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson_fight_poster.jpg)

, [Arlington, Texas](/wiki/Arlington,_Texas "Arlington, Texas")
, U.S.Tale of the tape

|     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Boxer | [Jake Paul](/wiki/Jake_Paul "Jake Paul") | [Mike Tyson](/wiki/Mike_Tyson "Mike Tyson") |
| Nickname | _El Gallo_  <br>("The Rooster") | Iron |
| Hometown | [Cleveland, Ohio](/wiki/Cleveland,_Ohio "Cleveland, Ohio")<br>, U.S. The bout took place on November 15, 2024, at the [AT&T Stadium](/wiki/AT%26T_Stadium "AT&T Stadium")
 in [Arlington, Texas](/wiki/Arlington,_Texas "Arlington, Texas")
, and was streamed globally on [Netflix](/wiki/Netflix "Netflix")
, with 65 million concurrent viewers[\[4\]](#cite_note-Variety-4)
[\[5\]](#cite_note-Bloomberg-5)
 making it the most-streamed sporting event ever at the time.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)
 Paul defeated Tyson via [unanimous decision](/wiki/Unanimous_decision "Unanimous decision")
.[\[3\]](#cite_note-CNN-3)

Originally, the bout was scheduled to take place on July 20 but was postponed due to Tyson suffering an ulcer flare-up aboard a plane.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

Background
----------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=1 "Edit section: Background")\
\]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Jake_Paul_%2853116882732%29_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Jake_Paul_%2853116882732%29_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Jake_Paul_(53116882732)_(cropped).jpg)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Mike_Tyson_Photo_Op_GalaxyCon_Austin_2023.jpg/250px-Mike_Tyson_Photo_Op_GalaxyCon_Austin_2023.jpg)](/wiki/File:Mike_Tyson_Photo_Op_GalaxyCon_Austin_2023.jpg)

[Jake Paul](/wiki/Jake_Paul "Jake Paul")
 (left) and [Mike Tyson](/wiki/Mike_Tyson "Mike Tyson")
 (right)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/%D7%98%D7%99%D7%99%D7%A1%D7%95%D7%9F_%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%95%D7%9C.jpg/250px-%D7%98%D7%99%D7%99%D7%A1%D7%95%D7%9F_%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%95%D7%9C.jpg)](/wiki/File:%D7%98%D7%99%D7%99%D7%A1%D7%95%D7%9F_%D7%95%D7%A4%D7%95%D7%9C.jpg)

[Broadway](/wiki/Broadway_(Manhattan) "Broadway (Manhattan)")
, [New York](/wiki/New_York_City "New York City")
, November 2024

On November 3, 2023, it was reported that Netflix was considering streaming a [boxing match](/wiki/Boxing_match "Boxing match")
 involving Jake Paul on their service.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

On March 7, 2024, [Netflix](/wiki/Netflix "Netflix")
 and [Most Valuable Promotions](/wiki/Most_Valuable_Promotions "Most Valuable Promotions")
 announced that they were partnering to host an event headlined by Paul facing former undisputed heavyweight world champion Mike Tyson on July 20 at the [AT&T Stadium](/wiki/AT%26T_Stadium "AT&T Stadium")
 in [Arlington, Texas](/wiki/Arlington,_Texas "Arlington, Texas")
.[\[4\]](#cite_note-Variety-4)
 On April 2, Tyson confirmed at the time the bout was sanctioned as an [exhibition bout](/wiki/Exhibition_bout "Exhibition bout")
.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)
 On April 10, Paul confirmed that they would be submitting a request to the Texas Combative Sports Program for the bout to be sanctioned as a [professional bout](/wiki/Professional_boxing "Professional boxing")
.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)
 On April 29, the [Texas Department of Licensing and Regulations](/wiki/Texas_Department_of_Licensing_and_Regulation "Texas Department of Licensing and Regulation")
 confirmed it approved the fighters' request and that the bout would be a sanctioned, professional fight.[\[11\]](#cite_note-Fox_Sports-11)

On May 31, Netflix announced that the event had been postponed due to Tyson suffering a [ulcer flare up](/wiki/Ulcer "Ulcer")
 while boarding a plane.[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)
 Paul took to X (formerly known as Twitter) to call out his rival and fellow YouTuber-turned-professional boxer [KSI](/wiki/KSI "KSI")
 to replace Tyson.[\[13\]](#cite_note-13)
 KSI responded and declined the offer stating he has a bout scheduled in [August](/wiki/KSI_vs_Slim_%26_Anthony_Taylor "KSI vs Slim & Anthony Taylor")
.[\[14\]](#cite_note-14)
 On June 7, Netflix confirmed the event was rescheduled to November 15.[\[15\]](#cite_note-15)

### Pre-fight press conferences

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=2 "Edit section: Pre-fight press conferences")\
\]

Three pre-fight [press conferences](/wiki/News_conference "News conference")
 were held in the following cities:

*   May 13 – [Apollo Theater](/wiki/Apollo_Theater "Apollo Theater")
    , [Manhattan, New York](/wiki/Manhattan "Manhattan")
    , U.S.[\[16\]](#cite_note-16)
    
*   August 18 – [Javits Center](/wiki/Javits_Center "Javits Center")
    , [New York City](/wiki/New_York_City "New York City")
    , U.S.[\[17\]](#cite_note-17)
    
*   November 13 – [Toyota Music Factory](/wiki/Toyota_Music_Factory "Toyota Music Factory")
    , [Irving, Texas](/wiki/Irving,_Texas "Irving, Texas")
    , U.S.[\[18\]](#cite_note-BBCSport-18)
    

During the final press conference, Tyson slapped Paul after Paul stepped on his toe during their face-off.[\[18\]](#cite_note-BBCSport-18)

### _Countdown: Paul vs. Mike Tyson Fight on Netflix Rescheduled for November"](https://variety.com/2024/tv/news/jake-paul-vs-mike-tyson-fight-netflix-livestream-rescheduled-1236028610/)

    . ["Fans spot 'real reason' why Mike Tyson savagely slapped Jake Paul the night before fight"](https://www.unilad.com/news/sport/mike-tyson-slap-jake-paul-boxing-match-reason-430112-20241115)
    . Many microphones and earpieces also experienced difficulties, with interviewee [Evander Holyfield](/wiki/Evander_Holyfield "Evander Holyfield")
 struggling to hear the host of the show because of issues with his earpiece.[\[5\]](#cite_note-Bloomberg-5)
 According to [Downdetector](/wiki/Downdetector "Downdetector")
, around 90,000 viewers reported outages in the hour leading up to the fight.[\[3\]](#cite_note-CNN-3)

### Allegations of fixing

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson&action=edit&section=15 "Edit section: Allegations of fixing")\
\]

Following the fight, a number of outlets expressed concerns that the fight was staged.     ."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The fight between Jake Paul and Mike Tyson took place on November 15, 2024, at the AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas. <image:17> The fight was streamed on Netflix.

Open Extended Reactions

[Jake Paul](/boxing/story/_/id/38041591/jake-problem-child-paul-biography-record-fights-more)
 defeated [Mike Tyson](/boxing/story/_/id/39717002/mike-tyson-biography-boxing-record-fights-more)
 by unanimous decision in an eight-round heavyweight match at AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas, on Friday.

All three judges scored the fight for Paul, 80-72, 79-73 and 79-73.

The fight, sanctioned by the Texas Department of Licensing and Regulation, was contested at 2-minute rounds, and both fighters wore 14-ounce gloves instead of the regular 10-ounce gloves for heavyweight fights.

Tyson, 58, and Paul, 27, the YouTuber-turned-boxer, were scheduled to meet on July 20, but [the fight was postponed](/boxing/story/_/id/40252311/mike-tyson-ulcer-forced-postpone-bout-vs-jake-paul)
 after Tyson received medical attention during a flight from Miami to Los Angeles in May for an ulcer flare-up.

Tyson (50-7, 44 KOs) became the youngest heavyweight champion at age 20 in 1986, and a year later he had unified all three major belts to become undisputed champion. Skip to main content Skip to navigation

 in February 2023, but he has won five straight fights, including the decision over Tyson, since. Mike Tyson and earns a victory at AT&T Stadium. He made six defenses of the three belts until losing in a historic upset to James "Buster" Douglas by 10th-round KO in February 1990.

Paul (11-1, 7 KOs) started his boxing career in 2020 with six consecutive victories fighting mostly against former MMA fighters. <image:3242>

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/5925790/2024/11/16/jake-paul-mike-tyson-boxing-results/): 
Content: "Jake Paul defeats Mike Tyson with ease in Netflix spectacle
===========================================================

!ARLINGTON, TEXAS - NOVEMBER 15: (L-R) Mike Tyson and Jake Paul fight during LIVE On Netflix: Jake Paul vs. He must die.”

Paul joins a list of Buster Douglas, Evander Holyfield, Lennox Lewis, Danny Williams and the aforementioned McBride as the men who have beaten Tyson.

Tyson’s loss went on his professional record, lowering his career mark to 50-7.

Required reading
----------------

*   [Mike Tyson’s many eras: From ‘Iron Mike’ to prison to Holyfield to a Jake Paul bout](https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/5921035/2024/11/15/mike-tyson-career-timeline/)
    
*   [What to know about boxing’s controversial fight between Mike Tyson and Jake Paul](https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/5921976/2024/11/15/jake-paul-mike-tyson-netflix-boxing/)
    
*   [Mike Tyson-Jake Paul boxing bout postponed due to Tyson’s recent ulcer flare up](https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/5533111/2024/05/31/mike-tyson-jake-paul-boxing-postponed/)

[!Connections: Sports Edition <image:3245>\

Jan 1, 2025\

Connections: Sports Edition\

Spot the pattern. Mike Tyson at AT&amp;amp;T Stadium on November 15, 2024 in Arlington, Texas. 28, 2025

* * *

In a display that fell short of even the most measured expectations that come with gimmick fights, [Jake Paul](https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/6435868/2025/06/26/jake-paul-boxing-julio-cesar-chavez-jr/)
 breezed past a 58-year-old Mike Tyson on Friday night in a bout that was heavy on nostalgia and bombast but lacking in any sort of competitive satisfaction.

Tyson landed just 18 punches in eight sluggish rounds. in 2021, shot back a puzzled look and a quick retort: “I’ll kill you, Mike.”

Netflix declined comment [on its technical issues,](https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/5925844/2024/11/16/netflix-buffering-freezing-jake-paul-mike-tyson/)
 which came in the leadup to the Tyson-Paul bout and especially undercut the most thrilling bout on the card, Katie Taylor’s controversial decision win over Amanda Serrano. By then, they were both surely richer by millions and the fight that didn’t matter in the first place proved to be one that fans wanted to quickly forget.

Advertisement

It was also a mixed night for Netflix, which streamed the bout to its hundreds of millions of subscribers without charging extra fees, but struggled to keep up with clearly high demand and widespread complaints of freezing, buffering and resolution problems.

“I wanted to give the fans a show but I didn’t want to hurt someone that didn’t need to be hurt,” [Paul](https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/6460122/2025/06/29/jake-paul-julio-cesar-chavez-jr-result/)
 told reporters afterward.

For about 60 seconds, it looked like Tyson might thrill the packed AT&T Stadium crowd in Arlington, Texas, with a momentary flashes of the presence he had during his heyday in the ’80s and early ’90s. But for the next 15 minutes, plus some breaks for deep breaths, he looked exactly like a man nearing his 60th birthday who hadn’t fought a professional boxing match in 19 years.

Paul spent much of the fight dancing around Tyson. Paul pieced him up with elementary combinations and some sharp left hooks, but even his glancing blows drew some reaction from a clearly underwhelmed crowd seeking any kind of highlight.

Afterward, Paul said it was an honor to share the ring with Tyson and called the former champion the GOAT.

As for the exhausted Tyson, he said he was “totally happy” with his performance, while admitting he went into the fight with an injury. His 11-1 record is padded with wins over subpar competition, and his one loss was to Tommy Fury, who boxes but had been better known as a reality TV personality and the half brother of Tyson Fury, the heavyweight star.

Paul didn’t call out any new opponents, but did say that he was the route for boxers to make big paydays, and repeated his claim that he could deliver that even to Canelo Alvarez, who is perhaps the sport’s most bankable star right now.

Paul claimed in the leadup to the fight that he was earning $40 million for the bout with Tyson, though the actual earnings for both headliners was not made public. Clearly, getting in the ring was a victory for both men even though their display barely qualified as a fight.

“There was a point where I was just like, he’s not really engaging back,” Paul said, adding: “I could just tell that his age was showing a little bit.”

Tyson, one of the biggest stars in sports when he was at his height, looked like a shell of the boxer who last fought professionally in 2005."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The New York Times reports that Jake Paul defeated Mike Tyson on November 15, 2024, in Arlington, Texas. <image:3245> The fight was streamed on Netflix. The article includes a photo of the fight.

# Instructions

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.

* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson):

In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)

* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:17> This is an authentic image of Mike Tyson posing with the Palestinian flag in the ring before his fight against Jake Paul on November, 15, 2024."

## Actions
```

image_search("Mike Tyson Palestinian flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The fight between Jake Paul and Mike Tyson took place on November 15, 2024, at the AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas. The fight was streamed on Netflix. Jake Paul defeated Mike Tyson by unanimous decision. (<image:17>)

Sources: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jake_Paul_vs._Mike_Tyson), [https://www.espn.com/boxing/story/_/id/42352328/mike-tyson-vs-jake-paul-live-boxing-updates-results-analysis](https://www.espn.com/boxing/story/_/id/42352328/mike-tyson-vs-jake-paul-live-boxing-updates-results-analysis), [https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/5925790/2024/11/16/jake-paul-mike-tyson-boxing-results/](https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/5925790/2024/11/16/jake-paul-mike-tyson-boxing-results/)

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:17> This is an authentic image of Mike Tyson posing with the Palestinian flag in the ring before his fight against Jake Paul on November, 15, 2024."

## Actions

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Instructions

* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

assassinations during the Gaza war")<br> and deaths of prominent individuals<br><br>*   [Saleh al-Arouri](/wiki/Assassination_of_Saleh_al-Arouri "Assassination of Saleh al-Arouri")<br>    <br>*   [Marwan Issa](/wiki/Assassination_of_Marwan_Issa "Assassination of Marwan Issa")<br>    <br>*   [Fuad Shukr](/wiki/Killing_of_Fuad_Shukr "Killing of Fuad Shukr")<br>    <br>*   [Ismail Safieddine")<br>    <br>*   Yahya Sinwar<br>*   [Mohammad Bagheri](/wiki/Mohammad_Bagheri_(general)#Death "Mohammad Bagheri (general)")<br>    <br>*   [Hossein Salami](/wiki/Hossein_Salami#Death "Hossein Salami")<br>    <br><br>* * *<br><br>See also<br><br>*   [Background](/wiki/Background_to_the_Gaza_war "Background to the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Antisemitism](/wiki/Antisemitism_during_the_Gaza_war "Antisemitism during the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Anti-Palestinianism](/wiki/Anti-Palestinianism_during_the_Gaza_war "Anti-Palestinianism during "Misinformation in the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Protests](/wiki/Gaza_war_protests "Gaza war protests")<br>    *   [university campuses](/wiki/2024_pro-Palestinian_protests_on_university_campuses "2024 pro-Palestinian protests on university campuses")<br>        <br>*   [All Eyes on Rafah](/wiki/All_Eyes_on_Rafah "All Eyes on Rafah")<br>    <br>*   [Israeli document leak scandal](/wiki/2024_Israeli_secret_document_leak_scandal "2024 Israeli secret document leak scandal")<br>    <br>*   [Israeli public diplomacy](/wiki/Israeli_public_diplomacy_in_the_Gaza_war "Israeli public diplomacy in the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Proposed U.S. The infantry fired a [MATADOR](/wiki/MATADOR "MATADOR")
 rocket at the building and raked it with machine gun fire.[\[51\]](#cite_note-52)

Following the incident, troops discovered a body that had a striking resemblance to Sinwar, dressed in military fatigues, with a grenade and a gun,[\[52\]](#cite_note-53)
 while assessing the collapsed building where the exchange occurred.[\[40\]](#cite_note-toi-staff-2024-41)
 Additional items found on his person included 40,000 shekels (NIS) in cash,[\[40\]](#cite_note-toi-staff-2024-41)
 a lighter and a passport unrelated to him, which belonged to a [UNRWA](/wiki/UNRWA "UNRWA")
 teacher.[\[53\]](#cite_note-54)
[\[54\]](#cite_note-55)
[\[55\]](#cite_note-jones-wsj-2024-56)
 It is reported that the three bodies were found carrying cash, weapons and fake IDs.[\[56\]](#cite_note-57)
[\[57\]](#cite_note-58)

Following this, Israeli officials informed the security cabinet of Sinwar's likely death. Further, he stated that the release of hostages was unlikely, as Hamas wishes to use them to pressure Israel into a full withdrawal from Gaza, a move that he calls entirely unacceptable, as it would enable Hamas to rebuild its military capabilities.[\[66\]](#cite_note-67)

_[The Economist](/wiki/The_Economist "The Economist")
_ reported that following the death of Yahya Sinwar, Hamas faces internal struggles regarding its power dynamics and ideological direction. The outcomes of these struggles, according to the report, will significantly impact Hamas's future, either leaning toward a path of moderation or increased Iranian-backed extremism.[\[67\]](#cite_note-Economist_2024-10-19-68)

Visuals of Sinwar's death
-------------------------

Wounded Yahya Sinwar stares at a drone sent to inspect the building after an armed clash and tosses a stick at it.

Following Sinwar's death, the IDF released images and drone footage depicting him wounded and slumped in a chair, aiming to portray him as a fugitive. They urged Israeli and US leaders to capitalize on this military success by negotiating an immediate deal for the hostages' release, stressing that true victory can only be achieved when all the captives are safely returned.[\[76\]](#cite_note-77)
[\[77\]](#cite_note-78)

### Hamas

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f0/Yahya_Sinwar%2C_2012_-_2_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Yahya_Sinwar%2C_2012_-_2_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Yahya_Sinwar,_2012_-_2_(cropped).jpg)

Sinwar in 2012

Initially, the Hamas-affiliated news agency [Gaza Now](/wiki/Gaza_Now "Gaza Now")
 denied Sinwar's death, posting: "Warning, the news that spoke about the assassination of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar is completely false, and the occupation's publication and circulation of this news is an attempt to collect intelligence information, \[as\] it did previously with leader [Muhammad al-Deif](/wiki/Muhammad_al-Deif "Muhammad al-Deif")
. It hurts to lose people, especially unique leaders like Yahya Sinwar, but we are sure we will win in the end."[\[12\]](#cite_note-jpost-until-aggression-stops-13)
 [Khalil al-Hayya](/wiki/Khalil_al-Hayya "Khalil al-Hayya")
, the [Qatar](/wiki/Qatar "Qatar")
\-based deputy leader of Hamas and the primary negotiator for Hamas in the hostage negotiations, said that the hostages would not be released until Israel withdrew from the Gaza Strip.[\[79\]](#cite_note-80)
 He said that Sinwar had died "facing and not retreating, engaging in the front lines and moving between combat positions" and called him "a continuation of the caravan of great [martyrs](/wiki/Martyrdom_in_Palestinian_society "Martyrdom in Palestinian society")
 in the footsteps of the founding Sheikh [Ahmed Yassin](/wiki/Ahmed_Yassin "Ahmed Yassin")
," adding that "Hamas is moving forward until the establishment of the Palestinian state on all Palestinian soil with Jerusalem as its capital."[\[80\]](#cite_note-81)
[\[81\]](#cite_note-82)

Hamas's political bureau called Sinwar's death "painful and distressing".[\[82\]](#cite_note-estrin-npr-2024-83)

### Middle East

*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d2/Flag_of_Palestine_-_short_triangle.svg/40px-Flag_of_Palestine_-_short_triangle.svg.png)[PLO](/wiki/Palestine_Liberation_Organization "Palestine Liberation Organization")
    : The group expressed its condolences for Sinwar's "[martyrdom](/wiki/Martyrdom_in_Palestinian_society "Martyrdom in Palestinian society")
    ", labelling him a "great national leader" and calling for unity among all Palestinian factions. Hezbollah also stated that his martyrdom will "strengthen the resolve and determination of the resistance in all the battlefields and arenas to proceed on the road of liberating Palestine and eradicating the cancerous Zionist tumour".[\[83\]](#cite_note-Al_Jazeera_2024-10-17-84)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Slogan_of_the_Houthi_Movement.svg/20px-Slogan_of_the_Houthi_Movement.svg.png)[Houthis](/wiki/Houthis "Houthis")
    : Houthi Leader [Abdul-Malik al-Houthi](/wiki/Abdul-Malik_al-Houthi "Abdul-Malik al-Houthi")
     called Sinwar a martyr who died in the “field of confrontation, valour, and honour.” Mohammad Abdelsalam, a spokesman for the group, expressed his "sincere condolences" to Hamas and Palestinians for Sinwar receiving the "medal of martyrdom", adding that Gaza and the Palestinian cause is "destined for victory, no matter how great the sacrifices".[\[85\]](#cite_note-86)
     Another spokesperson, [Yahya Saree](/wiki/Yahya_Saree "Yahya Saree")
    , said that the death of Sinwar "increases the determination of the resistance."[\[86\]](#cite_note-87)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/30/Flag_of_Jihad.svg/40px-Flag_of_Jihad.svg.png)[Al-Qaeda](/wiki/Al-Qaeda "Al-Qaeda")
    : [Abu Walid al-Masri](/wiki/Abu_Walid_al-Masri "Abu Walid al-Masri")
    , an advisor to [Saif al-Adel](/wiki/Saif_al-Adel "Saif al-Adel")
    , Al-Qaeda's current de facto emir, hailed Sinwar and urged Hamas to release Israeli hostages, stating that the focus on their recovery was overshadowing the plight of Palestinian prisoners held by Israel, and emphasized that the hostage issue should be "closed" to avoid further consequences.[\[87\]](#cite_note-88)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Flag_of_Iran.svg/40px-Flag_of_Iran.svg.png)[Iran](/wiki/Iran "Iran")
    : State media described Sinwar's death as "[martyrdom](/wiki/Martyrdom_in_Palestinian_society "Martyrdom in Palestinian society")
    " and praised him for dying in the struggle against Israel in Gaza.[\[88\]](#cite_note-NYT_2024-10-172-89)
     Hossein Kazeruni, a [hard-line](/wiki/Iranian_principlists "Iranian principlists")
     [cleric](/wiki/Shia_clergy "Shia clergy")
    , said on X that Mr. Sinwar died fighting Israel's military "like a man, weapon in hand, wrapped in [kaffiyeh](/wiki/Palestinian_keffiyeh "Palestinian keffiyeh")
    , chest out".[\[89\]](#cite_note-90)
    [\[88\]](#cite_note-NYT_2024-10-172-89)
     Foreign minister, [Abbas Araghchi](/wiki/Abbas_Araghchi "Abbas Araghchi")
    , praised Sinwar, adding that "Martyrs live forever, and the cause for liberation of Palestine from occupation is more alive than ever."[\[90\]](#cite_note-91)
     The [Iranian mission to the UN](/wiki/Permanent_Representative_of_Iran_to_the_United_Nations "Permanent Representative of Iran to the United Nations")
     stated that Sinwar's killing will "strengthen the spirit of resistance," adding that he "will become a role model for the youth and children who will follow his path toward the liberation of Palestine."[\[50\]](#cite_note-auto-51)
    [\[91\]](#cite_note-92)
    [\[92\]](#cite_note-93)
     [Supreme leader](/wiki/Supreme_Leader_of_Iran "Supreme Leader of Iran")
     [Ali Khamenei](/wiki/Ali_Khamenei "Ali Khamenei")
     described Sinwar as "a shining figure of resistance and struggle," stating that his death will not stop the '[Axis of Resistance](/wiki/Axis_of_Resistance "Axis of Resistance")
    .'[\[93\]](#cite_note-94)
    

### International

*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_the_Taliban.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_Taliban.svg.png)[Afghanistan](/wiki/Afghanistan "Afghanistan")
    : Government spokesperson [Zabihullah Mujahid](/wiki/Zabihullah_Mujahid "Zabihullah Mujahid")
     released a statement online sharing condolences for the "martyrdom" of Yahya Sinwar. His violent career as the leader of Hamas culminated in the single most devastating slaughter of Jewish people since the Holocaust." She also expressed hope that his death will bring about the end of the war.[\[97\]](#cite_note-98)
    [\[98\]](#cite_note-99)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Flag_of_Canada_%28Pantone%29.svg/40px-Flag_of_Canada_%28Pantone%29.svg.png)[Canada](/wiki/Canada "Canada")
    : [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Canada "Prime Minister of Canada")
     [Justin Trudeau](/wiki/Justin_Trudeau "Justin Trudeau")
     stated: "Yahya Sinwar, the brutal leader of the terrorist organization Hamas, has been eliminated by the IDF."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the killing of Yahya Sinwar, the leader of Hamas, on October 16, 2024, during a patrol in Tel al-Sultan, Rafah, Gaza Strip. <image:18> The article includes an image of Sinwar, wounded and in a chair, and mentions that a UNRWA teacher's passport was found on his person. The article also details reactions to his death from various groups and countries, including Hamas, Iran, and Afghanistan.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future): 
Content: "Accessibility links

*   [Skip to main content](#mainContent)
    
*   [Keyboard shortcuts for audio player](https://help.npr.org/contact/s/article?name=what-are-the-keyboard-shortcuts-for-using-the-npr-org-audio-player)
    

**What Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar's death means for Middle East** **What does the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar mean for the war in Gaza and the region beyond, and will it revive the chances of cease-fire and the release of the remaining hostages?**

What does Yahya Sinwar's death mean for the Middle East?
========================================================

  

October 18, 202411:24 AM ET

By 

[!Daniel Estrin <image:10152>](https://www.npr.org/people/576543610/daniel-estrin)

[Daniel Estrin](https://www.npr.org/people/576543610/daniel-estrin)

, 

[Willem Marx](https://www.npr.org/people/1129196134/willem-marx)

  !Yahya Sinwar, a founder of Hamas' military wing, talks during a rally in Khan Younis, southern Gaza Strip, in 2011. **Adel Hana/AP** ****hide caption****

****toggle caption****

Adel Hana/AP

The death of Hamas leader [Yahya Sinwar](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/17/nx-s1-5155887/hamas-yahya-sinwar-israel-gaza)
 at the hands of the Israeli military in Gaza Wednesday has prompted celebration and concern alike in Israel and beyond. "This is the time to go out, release the hostages, raise your hands, surrender."

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called Sinwar’s death the "beginning of the day after Hamas," and in a recorded video message said his demise indicated Hamas "will no longer rule Gaza."

  !A demonstrator holds a sign about the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar during a protest calling for a cease-fire deal and the immediate release of hostages held by Hamas on Thursday, in Tel Aviv, Israel. <image:10153>

Yahya Sinwar, a founder of Hamas' military wing, talks during a rally in Khan Younis, southern Gaza Strip, in 2011. 7, 2023, Hamas-led attacks in Israel represents a potential inflection point in the devastating and widening conflict that has continued into its second year.

The militant group confirmed Sinwar’s death in a statement released Friday. The Hamas political bureau said that it was “painful and distressing” to lose its leader, and declared that he has now become “an icon for the Palestinian people.”

The Palestinian militant group killed some 1,200 people and took some 250 hostages during the surprise attacks, according to Israeli officials.

### [Middle East](https://www.npr.org/sections/middle-east/)

### [How Yahya Sinwar's killing could affect Israel-Hamas negotiations](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157191/how-yahya-sinwars-killing-could-affect-israel-hamas-negotiations)

In response, Israel launched a military campaign in Gaza that has killed more than 42,400 Palestinians and injured more than 99,000, according to Gaza's Health Ministry. But the fact Sinwar was located and killed above ground suggests, Israeli's military leaders have said, that the group's options for safety are continuing to shrink.

But Sinwar’s death may complicate efforts to achieve one of Israel's goals for the military [occupation of Gaza that began](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/09/g-s1-27175/israel-hamas-war-gaza-map)
 12 months ago.

"Killing Sinwar means Israel has no one to talk to about the hostages in Gaza," said Kareem Jouda, a lawyer from Gaza. "They can do absolutely nothing bigger than what they have been doing," he added.

At Israel's border with Gaza Thursday, Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant called on remaining Hamas fighters in Gaza to take this moment to surrender.

"Yahya Sinwar ended his life being beaten, persecuted, fleeing for his life, not in command of his organization and only taking care of himself," he said. <image:10154>

A demonstrator holds a sign about the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar during a protest calling for a cease-fire deal and the immediate release of hostages held by Hamas on Thursday, in Tel Aviv, Israel. "The ball is in the hands of the Israeli government."  

Hostages key to any cease-fire
------------------------------

Israeli authorities believe there are still 101 hostages held inside Gaza, around a third of whom are believed to be dead, and for many of Israel's political elite, their return has now become the most crucial element to any potential cessation of hostilities, not just in Gaza but the wider region.

"Now, more than ever, we must act in every way possible to bring back the 101 hostages who are still being held in horrific conditions," Israeli President Isaac Herzog [wrote on social media](https://x.com/isaac_herzog/status/1846958555741491622)
.

Benny Gantz, a former head of the Israeli military and defense ministry and political rival of Netanyahu, [posted on social media](https://x.com/gantzbe/status/1846963282420084895?s=46)
 that Sinwar's death sent a message to Israel's enemies that the country's military would not rest until they "pay for their crimes." But he also said it should be leveraged to see hostages returned, while suggesting that Israeli forces would continue to operate inside Gaza for years to come.

Netanyahu noted this was "an important moment in the war," and insisted it was his "highest commitment" that the country's military and intelligence services would continue "with all our strength" to return the hostages.

In a public statement, the Israeli prime minister even promised a form of amnesty for surviving members of Hamas if they helped return captives."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The NPR article, published on October 18, 2024, discusses the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar. The article mentions that Sinwar's death has prompted reactions of celebration and concern. It also mentions that the Hamas political bureau confirmed Sinwar’s death and declared that he has now become “an icon for the Palestinian people.” <image:10153>, <image:10154>. The article also mentions that Israeli authorities believe there are still 101 hostages held inside Gaza.

What Does Yahya Sinwar’s Death Mean?
====================================

     !Photo: Majority World/Universal Images Group via Getty Images <image:10156>

Photo: Majority World/Universal Images Group via Getty Images

Critical Questions by [Jon B. He was the mastermind of Hamas’s October 7, 2023, attack on Israel, and he was thought to have been hiding underground for much of the time since.

**Q1: Does Yahya Sinwar’s death mean the end of the war in Gaza?**

**A1:** The war in Gaza is not over, but it has moved to a new phase. All rights reserved.

* * *

*   [](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://www.csis.org/analysis/what-does-yahya-sinwars-death-mean)

*   [](https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https://www.csis.org/analysis/what-does-yahya-sinwars-death-mean)

Image

!Jon Alterman <image:10157>

[](/people/jon-b-alterman)

### [Jon B. Alterman](/people/jon-b-alterman)

Published October 17, 2024

Remote Visualization

The Israeli government announced today that its soldiers had killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar in a firefight in southern Gaza. Sinwar seemed strongly opposed to compromise, so his death makes some sort of settlement more possible. Some may execute hostages in retribution for Sinwar’s death, some may seek to trade their hostages’ freedom for their own, and some may simply abandon hostages out of fear of what comes next. Sinwar’s death is important to Israelis who wanted to ensure that Hamas did not resurrect itself in Gaza. Because many Palestinians regarded Sinwar as a charismatic figure with credibility, his death weakens Hamas’s control over Gaza’s population. Israeli assassinations of previous Hamas leaders have not dampened that appeal, and Sinwar’s death is unlikely to, either. Whether this is a barrier to broader engagement in a post-Hamas future, or whether Israel and others can reach some understanding on this, will be a focus of discussions for the next several months.

**Q5: How will this play in Israeli politics?**

**A5:** In the immediate term, Sinwar’s death is a massive victory for Netanyahu."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The CSIS published an article on October 17, 2024, discussing the death of Yahya Sinwar, Hamas leader. <image:10156> shows a photo of Yahya Sinwar. The article states that the Israeli government announced that its soldiers had killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar in a firefight in southern Gaza.

The NPR article ([Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)) discusses the death of Yahya Sinwar and reactions to it.

The CSIS article ([Source](https://www.csis.org/analysis/what-does-yahya-sinwars-death-mean)) discusses the death of Yahya Sinwar, stating that the Israeli government announced that its soldiers had killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar. <image:18>, <image:10153>, <image:10154>, <image:10156>

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:18> This image shows a screenshot of the X profile of UNRWA which has placed a black band over its profile photo in mourning for the death of Yahya Sinwar, Hamas leader in the Gaza Strip, in October 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("UNRWA Yahya Sinwar death")
image_search("UNRWA profile picture mourning")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia article ([Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_of_Yahya_Sinwar)) discusses the killing of Yahya Sinwar, the leader of Hamas, on October 16, 2024, and mentions that a UNRWA teacher's passport was found on his person. The NPR article ([Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)) discusses the death of Yahya Sinwar and reactions to it.

The CSIS article ([Source](https://www.csis.org/analysis/what-does-yahya-sinwars-death-mean)) discusses the death of Yahya Sinwar, stating that the Israeli government announced that its soldiers had killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar. <image:18>, <image:10153>, <image:10154>, <image:10156>


### Evidence from `image_search`
From [Source](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-banning-unrwa-palestinian-territories-gaza-hamas-west-bank-rcna189554): 
Content: The NBC News article discusses Israel's ban on UNRWA in Palestinian territories. <image:10160>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that Yahya Sinwar, the Hamas leader, died in October 2024. However, the provided evidence does not contain any information about UNRWA placing a black band over its profile photo in mourning for Sinwar. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified with the available information.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:18> This image shows a screenshot of the X profile of UNRWA which has placed a black band over its profile photo in mourning for the death of Yahya Sinwar, Hamas leader in the Gaza Strip, in October 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("UNRWA Yahya Sinwar death")
image_search("UNRWA profile picture mourning")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia article ([Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_of_Yahya_Sinwar)) discusses the killing of Yahya Sinwar, the leader of Hamas, on October 16, 2024, and mentions that a UNRWA teacher's passport was found on his person. The NPR article ([Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)) discusses the death of Yahya Sinwar and reactions to it.

The CSIS article ([Source](https://www.csis.org/analysis/what-does-yahya-sinwars-death-mean)) discusses the death of Yahya Sinwar, stating that the Israeli government announced that its soldiers had killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar. <image:18>, <image:10153>, <image:10154>, <image:10156>


### Evidence from `image_search`
From [Source](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-banning-unrwa-palestinian-territories-gaza-hamas-west-bank-rcna189554): 
Content: The NBC News article discusses Israel's ban on UNRWA in Palestinian territories. <image:10160>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Yahya Sinwar, the Hamas leader, died in October 2024. However, the provided evidence does not contain any information about UNRWA placing a black band over its profile photo in mourning for Sinwar. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified with the available information.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms the death of Yahya Sinwar in October 2024. However, there is no information about UNRWA's X profile picture.

`not enough information`
_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.dw.com/en/fact-check-black-ribbon-on-unrwa-logo-does-not-show-mourning-for-sinwar/a-70532996): 
Content: "However, a look at the account and specifically at its profile picture over the past months with the help of web archiving tools shows that the black ribbon has been added long before that.

**Claim:** "UNRWA appears to be mourning the death of Yahya Sinwar. Sinwar is considered the mastermind of the October 7, 2023, terrorist attacks on Israel in which Hamas and other militant organizations killed more than 1,200 people and abducted another 250 people into Gaza. 

Since Sinwar's death, there have been many posts on X claiming that the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA) changed its account's  profile picture and added the black ribbon to its logo as a sign of mourning for him. https://p.dw.com/p/4lwqy

UNRWA provides humanitarian relief for Palestinians in the Palestinian Territories and neighboring countries.Image: AFP/Getty Images

Advertisement

Israel's military killed its top target in Gaza, Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz [confirmed late on Thursday](/en/hamas-leader-yahya-sinwar-killed-in-gaza-israel/a-70524393)
. The claim can be found in several viral X posts [calling for a defunding](https://archive.ph/jCCIQ "External link — calling for a defunding")
 of the UN organization as it is allegedly mourning the death of the head of Hamas.

**DW Fact check:** False

The black ribbon alongside the UNRWA logo symbolizes solidarity with the victims of war and has been a part of the X account's profile picture since at least October 22, 2023, when UNRWA announced in a [post on X](https://archive.ph/djuKR "External link — post on X")
 that it was in shock and mourning after the killing of 29 of its colleagues in Gaza since October 7. On its official Facebook account, UNRWA changed its profile picture to the UNRWA logo and the black ribbon on [October 11, 2023](https://archive.ph/bupKv "External link — October 11, 2023")
. 

The black ribbon alongside the UNRWA logo has been a part of the X account's profile picture since at least October 22Image: UNRWA/X.com

We have looked at several UNRWA social media accounts on different social media platforms, but not all have the black ribbon on their profile images. All UNRWA accounts added a black stripe to their profile," says [this post](https://archive.ph/6ctDD "External link — this post")
 on X. On X, the [EU account of UNRWA](https://x.com/UNRWA_EU "External link — EU account of UNRWA")
 has the ribbon but the [UNRWA USA](https://x.com/unrwausa "External link — UNRWA USA")
, for example, does not.   

[DW Fact check](/en/fact-check/t-56584214)
 has reached out to UNRWA for a statement.

UNRWA target of disinformation campaigns
----------------------------------------

At the beginning of 2024, Israel claimed that some 450 UNRWA workers in Gaza were "terrorists." [A review](/en/unrwa-review-finds-neutrality-issues-no-terror-proof/a-68893802)
 of the UN agency's neutrality was prompted due to these accusations. However, the 54-page report identified "neutrality-related issues" in the implementation of the "robust" procedures UNRWA has in place to "ensure compliance with the humanitarian principles of neutrality."

Since then, the UN organization has been the target of [claims on social media](https://archive.ph/uEGYu "External link — claims on social media")
 that it is supporting terrorists, and calls to end to its funding. 

Due to the variety and amount of claims, the UNRWA addressed the main allegations in a [Claims versus Facts](https://www.unrwa.org/unrwa-claims-versus-facts-february-2024 "External link — Claims versus Facts")
 page published on its official website in May 2024. 

_Edited by: Tetyana Klug_

Advertisement

[Skip next section Related topics](#post-related-topics)

Related topics
--------------"

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The DW article fact-checks the claim that UNRWA is mourning Yahya Sinwar's death by adding a black ribbon to its profile picture. The article states that the black ribbon was added to the profile picture before Sinwar's death, as early as October 22, 2023, to show solidarity with the victims of war. The article also mentions that not all UNRWA social media accounts have the black ribbon. The article was published by DW.

**Several social media users shared claims that the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA) added a black stripe to its social media accounts profile pictures mourning the recent killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar in Gaza. ! The photo has writing that reads "UNRWA Twitter accounts add black strip to profile after Sinwar's elimination."

The claim was repeated by [multiple](https://x.com/LuanaGoriss/status/1847091894305669311)
 [accounts](https://x.com/KevinVuongMP/status/1847076306946601050)
 on [X](https://x.com/DanFriedman81/status/1847045484319592745)
, [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ken.khavin/posts/pfbid02FB33E6hxtpxLYT9nswXswK9ySunaj8r6yFSNHFGi9nJupg4TZgVEe2Z8RgcEKH12l)
 and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/israel.against.hamas/p/DBRsDhlNHI5/)
.

### Rating: False

Hamas leader Sinwar, one of the chief architects of the attack on Israel last October, was killed during an Israeli military operation in Gaza on Oct. 22 of last year, and archives of the group's social media profile show the ribbon's presence before Sinwar's death.**

An [Oct. <image:10164>

Palestinian children, who fled with their parents from their houses in the Palestinian refugee camp of Ein el-Hilweh, gather in the backyard of an UNRWA (United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East) school, in the southern port city of Sidon, Lebanon, Tuesday, Sept. 17 post on X](https://x.com/lkajomovitz/status/1847051935578235372)
, formerly known as Twitter, shared an image containing a group of screenshots of UNRWA social media account photos with a black band over its logo. 16.

[UNRWA's communications director Juliette Touma](https://www.unrwa.org/tags/juliette-touma)
 said in an [Oct. 22, 2023 post on the agency's official X account that was [archived](https://archive.ph/djuKR)
 about 13 hours later on internet archiving tool Archive.today shows a black band over the corner of its logo.

"We are in shock and mourning. Half of these colleagues were UNRWA teachers," the post reads.

"As an Agency, we are devastated."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Canadian Press News fact-checked the claim that UNRWA added a black band to its social media profiles to mourn Yahya Sinwar's death. The fact-check found the claim to be false. The black band was present on UNRWA's social media profiles before Sinwar's death. <image:10163>, <image:10164>

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:18> This image shows a screenshot of the X profile of UNRWA which has placed a black band over its profile photo in mourning for the death of Yahya Sinwar, Hamas leader in the Gaza Strip, in October 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("UNRWA Yahya Sinwar death")
image_search("UNRWA profile picture mourning")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia article ([Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_of_Yahya_Sinwar)) discusses the killing of Yahya Sinwar, the leader of Hamas, on October 16, 2024, and mentions that a UNRWA teacher's passport was found on his person. The NPR article ([Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)) discusses the death of Yahya Sinwar and reactions to it.

The CSIS article ([Source](https://www.csis.org/analysis/what-does-yahya-sinwars-death-mean)) discusses the death of Yahya Sinwar, stating that the Israeli government announced that its soldiers had killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar. <image:18>, <image:10153>, <image:10154>, <image:10156>


### Evidence from `image_search`
From [Source](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-banning-unrwa-palestinian-territories-gaza-hamas-west-bank-rcna189554): 
Content: The NBC News article discusses Israel's ban on UNRWA in Palestinian territories. <image:10160>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Yahya Sinwar, the Hamas leader, died in October 2024. However, the provided evidence does not contain any information about UNRWA placing a black band over its profile photo in mourning for Sinwar. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified with the available information.


## Actions
```
web_search("UNRWA profile picture mourning Yahya Sinwar")
image_search("UNRWA profile picture")
```

Citizens need accurate information to make sound decisions. PesaCheck is Africa’s largest indigenous fact-checking organisation, debunking misleading claims and deciphering the often confusing numbers quoted by public figures in 16 African countries.

[Follow publication](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fsubscribe%2Fcollection%2Fpesa-check&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Ffalse-unrwa-didnt-update-its-profile-photo-to-mourn-the-death-of-hamas-leader-yahya-sinwar-f8219db942b5&collection=PesaCheck&collectionId=ab41f21aa9a9&source=post_page---post_publication_sidebar-ab41f21aa9a9-f8219db942b5---------------------post_publication_sidebar------------------)

FALSE: UNRWA didn’t update its profile photo to mourn the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar
============================================================================================

**The black ribbon is a tribute to UNRWA team members killed in Gaza.**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

[![PesaCheck](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fill:64:64/0*ttzO0bKO1LLBQdao.jpg)](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--f8219db942b5---------------------------------------)

[PesaCheck](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--f8219db942b5---------------------------------------)

4 min read

·

Oct 28, 2024

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fvote%2Fpesa-check%2Ff8219db942b5&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Ffalse-unrwa-didnt-update-its-profile-photo-to-mourn-the-death-of-hamas-leader-yahya-sinwar-f8219db942b5&user=PesaCheck&userId=c75918c2df6e&source=---header_actions--f8219db942b5---------------------clap_footer------------------)

\--

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fbookmark%2Fp%2Ff8219db942b5&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Ffalse-unrwa-didnt-update-its-profile-photo-to-mourn-the-death-of-hamas-leader-yahya-sinwar-f8219db942b5&source=---header_actions--f8219db942b5---------------------bookmark_footer------------------)

Listen

Share

Press enter or click to view image in full size

A [post](https://archive.ph/KV3K0)
 shared on X (formerly Twitter), with an image claiming the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA) added a black band to their profile photo to mourn the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, is FALSE.

The post reads, “UNRWA has added a black band to their profile photo to mourn the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar. Today, 230 team members killed: friends and colleagues.”

Press enter or click to view image in full size

The logo was [updated](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=728436779316657&set=a.287044800122526)
 to the agency’s official Facebook profile on 18 October 2023.

Press enter or click to view image in full size

PesaCheck has looked into a post shared on X with an image claiming UNRWA added a black band to their profile photo to mourn the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, and finds it to be FALSE.

_This post is part of an ongoing series of PesaCheck fact-checks examining content marked as_ **_potential misinformation_** _on Facebook and other social media platforms._

[_By partnering with Facebook and similar social media platforms_](/pesacheck-and-facebook-partner-to-fight-misinformation-in-kenya-d6a45ee70c18?gi=d2cb1ae7440)
_, third-party fact-checking organisations like PesaCheck are helping to sort fact from fiction. They’re not even pretending anymore.”

Press enter or click to view image in full size

The Israeli army [killed](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/18/how-was-yahya-sinwar-killed-what-we-know-so-far)
 Hamas leader Sinwar on 17 October 2024. The Israeli troops have been at [war](https://edition.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-25-24-intl-hnk/index.html)
 with the Palestinian militant group since 7 October 2023, after an attack that Sinwar [reportedly](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-67473719)
 planned.

UNRWA has been offering [humanitarian aid](https://www.unrwa.org/resources/reports/unrwa-situation-report-143-situation-gaza-strip-and-west-bank-including-east-jerusalem)
 in the Gaza strip. The agency has, however, not changed its logo to mourn Sinwar.

A Google keyword [search](https://archive.ph/OZDVo)
 for “UNRWA black band logo” established that it predates the Hamas leader’s death.

UNRWA [published](https://www.unrwa.org/newsroom/official-statements/message-juliette-touma-unrwa-director-communications)
 a [message](https://x.com/JulietteTouma/status/1847296170667749697?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1847296170667749697%7Ctwgr%5E0fc712f3a38031c2ab1a09e60b95ac8dae886b6d%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.unrwa.org%2Fnewsroom%2Fofficial-statements%2Fmessage-juliette-touma-unrwa-director-communications)
 from its director of communications Juliette Touma on its website, explaining the meaning of the logo.

The message reads, “On 22 October 2023, we reached a very sad milestone = 20 UNRWA team members killed in Gaza. It was co-founded by_ [**_Catherine Gicheru_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/catherine-gicheru)
 _and_ [**_Justin Arenstein_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/justin-arenstein)
_, and is being incubated by the continent’s largest civic technology and data journalism accelerator:_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from PesaCheck, published on October 28, 2024, states that a post claiming UNRWA added a black band to its profile photo to mourn the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar is FALSE. The black ribbon is a tribute to UNRWA team members killed in Gaza. The article mentions that the Israeli army killed Sinwar on October 17, 2024.

_________________________



SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:18> This image shows a screenshot of the X profile of UNRWA which has placed a black band over its profile photo in mourning for the death of Yahya Sinwar, Hamas leader in the Gaza Strip, in October 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("UNRWA Yahya Sinwar death")
image_search("UNRWA profile picture mourning")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia article ([Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_of_Yahya_Sinwar)) discusses the killing of Yahya Sinwar, the leader of Hamas, on October 16, 2024, and mentions that a UNRWA teacher's passport was found on his person. The NPR article ([Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)) discusses the death of Yahya Sinwar and reactions to it.

The CSIS article ([Source](https://www.csis.org/analysis/what-does-yahya-sinwars-death-mean)) discusses the death of Yahya Sinwar, stating that the Israeli government announced that its soldiers had killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar. <image:18>, <image:10153>, <image:10154>, <image:10156>


### Evidence from `image_search`
From [Source](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-banning-unrwa-palestinian-territories-gaza-hamas-west-bank-rcna189554): 
Content: The NBC News article discusses Israel's ban on UNRWA in Palestinian territories. <image:10160>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Yahya Sinwar, the Hamas leader, died in October 2024. However, the provided evidence does not contain any information about UNRWA placing a black band over its profile photo in mourning for Sinwar. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified with the available information.


## Actions
```
web_search("UNRWA profile picture mourning Yahya Sinwar")
image_search("UNRWA profile picture")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.dw.com/en/fact-check-black-ribbon-on-unrwa-logo-does-not-show-mourning-for-sinwar/a-70532996): 
Content: The DW article fact-checks the claim that UNRWA is mourning Yahya Sinwar's death by adding a black ribbon to its profile picture. The article states that the black ribbon was added to the profile picture before Sinwar's death, as early as October 22, 2023, to show solidarity with the victims of war. The article also mentions that not all UNRWA social media accounts have the black ribbon. The article was published by DW.


From [Source](https://www.thecanadianpressnews.ca/fact_checking/black-band-on-unrwas-social-media-profiles-appeared-before-yahya-sinwars-death/article_33032eb2-f64b-55c6-8a57-3289e6a014cf.html): 
Content: The Canadian Press News fact-checked the claim that UNRWA added a black band to its social media profiles to mourn Yahya Sinwar's death. The fact-check found the claim to be false. The black band was present on UNRWA's social media profiles before Sinwar's death. <image:10163>, <image:10164>


From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/false-unrwa-didnt-update-its-profile-photo-to-mourn-the-death-of-hamas-leader-yahya-sinwar-f8219db942b5): 
Content: The search result from PesaCheck, published on October 28, 2024, states that a post claiming UNRWA added a black band to its profile photo to mourn the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar is FALSE. The black ribbon is a tribute to UNRWA team members killed in Gaza. The article mentions that the Israeli army killed Sinwar on October 17, 2024.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The DW article ([https://www.dw.com/en/fact-check-black-ribbon-on-unrwa-logo-does-not-show-mourning-for-sinwar/a-70532996](https://www.dw.com/en/fact-check-black-ribbon-on-unrwa-logo-does-not-show-mourning-for-sinwar/a-70532996)) fact-checks the claim that UNRWA is mourning Yahya Sinwar's death, stating that the black ribbon was added to the profile picture before Sinwar's death, as early as October 22, 2023, to show solidarity with the victims of war. The Canadian Press News ([https://www.thecanadianpressnews.ca/fact_checking/black-band-on-unrwas-social-media-profiles-appeared-before-yahya-sinwars-death/article_33032eb2-f64b-55c6-8a57-3289e6a014cf.html](https://www.thecanadianpressnews.ca/fact_checking/black-band-on-unrwas-social-media-profiles-appeared-before-yahya-sinwars-death/article_33032eb2-f64b-55c6-8a57-3289e6a014cf.html)) also fact-checked the claim and found it to be false, as the black band was present before Sinwar's death. PesaCheck ([https://pesacheck.org/false-unrwa-didnt-update-its-profile-photo-to-mourn-the-death-of-hamas-leader-yahya-sinwar-f8219db942b5](https://pesacheck.org/false-unrwa-didnt-update-its-profile-photo-to-mourn-the-death-of-hamas-leader-yahya-sinwar-f8219db942b5)) states that the claim is false, and the black ribbon is a tribute to UNRWA team members killed in Gaza. <image:10163>, <image:10164>

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background.

NONE

The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

## Claim

```

```
