CNN  — 

[Ukraine](https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/18/europe/ukraine-russia-kherson-front-lines/index.html)
 and Russia exchanged aerial assaults overnight, just hours after the Kremlin agreed to temporarily halt attacks on energy infrastructure targets, but stopped short of signing off on a broader ceasefire sought by the US.

President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump [spoke by phone](https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/18/politics/trump-putin-ceasefire-russia-ukraine-war/index.html)
 on Tuesday, with the Russian leader not agreeing to the 30-day truce that Trump has endorsed and Ukraine has agreed to. The White House said a narrower pause on attacking energy targets would go into effect followed by negotiations over a broader ceasefire.

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Wednesday accused Putin of already breaking his pledge, saying that Russia attacked Ukraine with 150 drones overnight, including strikes on energy facilities.

The Kremlin also condemned an overnight attack on an oil facility in Russia, saying it showed Ukraine’s “lack of will” to reach a deal – although Kyiv was not part of the negotiation talks, and no formal agreement has been signed.

Zelensky said Tuesday that while Kyiv supported the pause in attacks on energy targets, he wanted to know the details behind the proposal that Trump and Putin discussed in their bilateral meeting.

[![Russian President Vladimir Putin gestures during the plenary session of Russia Union of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs, March 18, 2025, in Moscow, Russia. President Donald Trump.](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/gettyimages-2205177807.jpg?c=16x9&q=h_144,w_256,c_fill)\
\
Russian President Vladimir Putin gestures during the plenary session of Russia Union of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs, March 18, 2025, in Moscow, Russia. President Donald Trump.\
\
Getty Images\
\
Related article Putin just called Trump’s bluff on Ukraine, with the Russian art of the ‘no’ deal](/2025/03/18/europe/analysis-putin-trump-phone-call-ukraine-intl-latam)

“Putin essentially rejected the proposal of a comprehensive ceasefire. There were strikes on transportation, unfortunately, two hospitals were hit, and on urban infrastructure,” Zelensky said during a news conference in Finland.

[![KHERSON, UKRAINE - FEBRUARY 13: A residential building in Central district damaged after Russian shelling on February 13, 2025 in Kherson, Ukraine. (Photo by Olexandr Kornyakov/Suspilne Ukraine/JSC "UA:PBC"/Global Images Ukraine via Getty Images)](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/gettyimages-2199389809.jpg?c=16x9&q=h_144,w_256,c_fill)\
\
KHERSON, UKRAINE - FEBRUARY 13: A residential building in Central district damaged after Russian shelling on February 13, 2025 in Kherson, Ukraine. (Photo by Olexandr Kornyakov/Suspilne Ukraine/JSC "UA:PBC"/Global Images Ukraine via Getty Images)\
\
Olexandr Kornyakov/Suspilne Ukraine/Global Images Ukraine/Getty Images\
\
Related article ‘It’s just horror’: Life on the streets of Ukraine’s front-line ghost city](/2025/03/18/europe/ukraine-russia-kherson-front-lines)

Meanwhile, Russia’s defense ministry said Wednesday it had shot down 57 drones launched by Ukraine overnight, with 35 of those intercepted and destroyed over the Kursk border region.

Authorities in the southern Russian region of Krasnodar said a Ukrainian drone had caused a fire at an oil depot near the village of Kavkazskaya, Reuters reported. According to our data, the enemy’s grouping in the Kursk direction currently consists of 70,000 soldiers.”

The commander also said that the use of guided aerial bombs and North Korean soldiers contributed to Russia’s “rapid advancement.” He said North Korean troops’ assault tactics had become more modern in recent weeks.

“Even if we are now on the defensive, we are still grinding the enemy. Russia released an additional 22 seriously wounded POWs.](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/photo-2025-03-19-14-47-24.JPG?q=w_1110,c_fill)

An expected prisoner swap between Russia and Ukraine took place Wednesday, with 175 servicemen exchanged on each side."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The CNN article, published on March 19, 2025, discusses the exchange of attacks between Ukraine and Russia, hours after a call between Trump and Putin. The article mentions that Zelenskyy accused Putin of breaking his pledge regarding a pause in attacks, stating that Russia attacked Ukraine with 150 drones overnight. <image:40> is not present in the article.

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/03/07/zelenskyy-calls-for-air-and-sea-truce-after-large-scale-russian-missile-attack): 
Content: "The "first steps toward real peace must include forcing the sole source of this war, Russia, to stop such attacks against life,” the Ukrainian leader said.

Russia targeted Ukraine's energy infrastructure overnight in a large-scale missile and drone attack, Ukrainian officials said Friday.

At least 10 people, including a child, were wounded, authorities said.

Energy Minister Herman Halushchenko described the attack as "massive" in a post on Facebook.

“Russia is trying to hurt ordinary Ukrainians by striking energy and gas production facilities, without abandoning its goal of leaving us without light and heat, and causing the greatest harm to ordinary citizens,” Halushchenko said.

In response, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said Friday that energy supplies were a legitimate target in the war, as they were linked to Ukraine's "military industrial complex and weapons production."

The attack came hours after Zelenskyy announced that talks with the US on ending the three-year war would take place in Saudi Arabia next week.

*   ['Positive movement' in US-Ukraine relationship, says Zelenskyy ahead of EU Summit](/2025/03/05/positive-movement-in-us-ukraine-relationship-says-zelenskyy-ahead-of-eu-summit)
    
*   [EU leaders meet to discuss Ukraine's future as Trump pushes for fast peace deal](/my-europe/2025/03/06/eu-leaders-meet-to-discuss-ukraines-future-as-trump-pushes-for-fast-peace-deal)
    

He first suggested initial steps to stopping the war — including a halt on firing missiles, drones, and bombs at energy and other civilian infrastructure — on Tuesday. ![Euronews logo](https://static.euronews.com/website/images/logos/logo-euronews-stacked-outlined-72x72-grey-9.svg) Advertisement

Copy/paste the article video embed link below:  ![Copy to clipboard](https://static.euronews.com/website/images/vector/icon-copy-to-clipboard.svg) Copied

The overnight bombardment comes days after Washington announced it would stop sharing military support and intelligence with Ukraine.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![](https://static.euronews.com/website/images/logos/logo-euronews-stacked-outlined-72x72-grey-9.svg) ADVERTISEMENT

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called for an air and sea truce on Friday after Russia bombarded Ukraine's energy infrastructure overnight.

Writing on Telegram, he reiterated that there must be "silence" in the seas and skies over Ukraine. Zelenskyy has also proposed ceasing combat operations in the Black Sea to allow safe shipping.

Zelenskyy's proposals contain elements of those suggested by French President Emmanuel Macron during last week's summit of leaders in London.

In an interview with Le Figaro newspaper, Macron proposed a four-week truce in the "air, sea and on energy infrastructure" that would not cover fighting along the frontline in the east, as this would be complex to "monitor".

France's Foreign Minister Joel-Noel Barrot reiterated that a temporary pause would allow European allies to determine whether Russia was acting in "good faith" when committing to a true.

"That's when real peace negotiations can start," Barrot said.

Russia has not publicly commented on the French proposals for peace.

Also on Tuesday, the Ukrainian leader announced he was ready to work under US President Donald Trump's "strong leadership" to get lasting peace, signalling a turnaround from when he left the White House following a spat between the two last week.

The US temporarily paused both military aid and [intelligence](https://www.euronews.com/2025/03/05/us-puts-intelligence-sharing-with-ukraine-on-pause-cia-director-says)
 to Ukraine this week following the public argument, although officials suggested that the latter pause would be lifted if Ukraine quickly came back to the negotiating table.

Zelenskyy has faced intense US pressure to make concessions ahead of any peace talks, whilst he has been pushing for security guarantees for Kyiv.

The article mentions Zelenskyy's proposals for stopping the war, including halting attacks on energy and civilian infrastructure. It also discusses talks with the US on ending the war. <image:40>

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:40> This image shows Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in March 2025 signing Israeli bombs intended for use against Palestinians in Gaza."

## Actions
```
web_search("Zelenskyy signing bombs March 2025")
image_search("Zelenskyy signing bombs")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://spotlight.ebu.ch/p/video-caption-falsely-claims-zelenskyy): 
Content: The search result from Spotlight by EBU, published on March 13, 2025, addresses a claim that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed artillery shells destined for use in Gaza. The article states that the video and images were shared online with captions falsely claiming Zelenskyy signed bombs to be dropped on Gazans. The video actually shows Zelenskyy at a U.S. munitions factory. The video was shared on September 23, 2024, and the handwritten messages do not reference Ukraine’s war with Russia or Israel’s war in Gaza. <image:40>


From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/19/europe/ukraine-russia-drone-attacks-intl-hnk): 
Content: The CNN article, published on March 19, 2025, discusses the exchange of attacks between Ukraine and Russia, hours after a call between Trump and Putin. The article mentions that Zelenskyy accused Putin of breaking his pledge regarding a pause in attacks, stating that Russia attacked Ukraine with 150 drones overnight. <image:40> is not present in the article.


From [Source](https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/03/07/zelenskyy-calls-for-air-and-sea-truce-after-large-scale-russian-missile-attack): 
Content: The search result from Euronews, published on March 7, 2025, reports that Volodymyr Zelenskyy called for an air and sea truce after a Russian missile attack. The article mentions Zelenskyy's proposals for stopping the war, including halting attacks on energy and civilian infrastructure. It also discusses talks with the US on ending the war. <image:40>


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Spotlight by EBU article from March 13, 2025, addresses a claim that Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed artillery shells destined for use in Gaza. The video actually shows Zelenskyy at a U.S. munitions factory, and the video was shared on September 23, 2024. The handwritten messages do not reference Ukraine’s war with Russia or Israel’s war in Gaza. ([https://spotlight.ebu.ch/p/video-caption-falsely-claims-zelenskyy](https://spotlight.ebu.ch/p/video-caption-falsely-claims-zelenskyy))

The CNN article from March 19, 2025, discusses the exchange of attacks between Ukraine and Russia. ([https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/19/europe/ukraine-russia-drone-attacks-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/19/europe/ukraine-russia-drone-attacks-intl-hnk)) The Euronews article from March 7, 2025, reports that Zelenskyy called for an air and sea truce after a Russian missile attack. ([https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/03/07/zelenskyy-calls-for-air-and-sea-truce-after-large-scale-russian-missile-attack](https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/03/07/zelenskyy-calls-for-air-and-sea-truce-after-large-scale-russian-missile-attack)) <image:40>

Claim: "<image:40> This image shows Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in March 2025 signing Israeli bombs intended for use against Palestinians in Gaza."

```
image_search("Zelenskyy signing bombs")
```

Content: "

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:40> This image shows Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in March 2025 signing Israeli bombs intended for use against Palestinians in Gaza."

## Actions
```
web_search("Zelenskyy signing bombs March 2025")
image_search("Zelenskyy signing bombs")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2024/sep/25/trump-zelenskyy-ukraine-feud-republicans-election-interference): 
Content: The Guardian published an image of Zelenskyy signing a bomb. <image:7264>


From [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c5y30244467o): 
Content: The BBC News website shows an image of Volodymyr Zelenskyy signing what appear to be artillery shells. <image:7265>


From [Source](https://penncapital-star.com/government-politics/shapiro-casey-meet-with-zelenskyy-at-scranton-pennsylvania-ammunitions-factory/): 
Content: The Penn Capital-Star published an image of Volodymyr Zelenskyy. <image:7267>


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Guardian published an image of Zelenskyy signing a bomb (<image:7264>). The BBC News website shows an image of Volodymyr Zelenskyy signing what appear to be artillery shells (<image:7265>). The Penn Capital-Star published an image of Volodymyr Zelenskyy (<image:7267>).

_________________________



DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:40> This image shows Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in March 2025 signing Israeli bombs intended for use against Palestinians in Gaza."

## Actions
```
web_search("Zelenskyy signing bombs March 2025")
image_search("Zelenskyy signing bombs")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Spotlight by EBU article from March 13, 2025, addresses a claim that Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed artillery shells destined for use in Gaza. The video actually shows Zelenskyy at a U.S. munitions factory, and the video was shared on September 23, 2024. The handwritten messages do not reference Ukraine’s war with Russia or Israel’s war in Gaza. ([https://spotlight.ebu.ch/p/video-caption-falsely-claims-zelenskyy](https://spotlight.ebu.ch/p/video-caption-falsely-claims-zelenskyy))

The CNN article from March 19, 2025, discusses the exchange of attacks between Ukraine and Russia. ([https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/19/europe/ukraine-russia-drone-attacks-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/19/europe/ukraine-russia-drone-attacks-intl-hnk)) The Euronews article from March 7, 2025, reports that Zelenskyy called for an air and sea truce after a Russian missile attack. ([https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/03/07/zelenskyy-calls-for-air-and-sea-truce-after-large-scale-russian-missile-attack](https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/03/07/zelenskyy-calls-for-air-and-sea-truce-after-large-scale-russian-missile-attack)) <image:40>


### Evidence from `image_search`
The Guardian published an image of Zelenskyy signing a bomb (<image:7264>). The BBC News website shows an image of Volodymyr Zelenskyy signing what appear to be artillery shells (<image:7265>). The Penn Capital-Star published an image of Volodymyr Zelenskyy (<image:7267>).


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. The evidence indicates that the image shows Zelenskyy signing artillery shells at a U.S. munitions factory. The video was shared on September 23, 2024, not in March 2025. The handwritten messages do not reference the war in Ukraine or the conflict in Gaza.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:40> This image shows Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in March 2025 signing Israeli bombs intended for use against Palestinians in Gaza."

## Actions
```
web_search("Zelenskyy signing bombs March 2025")
image_search("Zelenskyy signing bombs")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Spotlight by EBU article from March 13, 2025, addresses a claim that Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed artillery shells destined for use in Gaza. The video actually shows Zelenskyy at a U.S. munitions factory, and the video was shared on September 23, 2024. The handwritten messages do not reference Ukraine’s war with Russia or Israel’s war in Gaza. ([https://spotlight.ebu.ch/p/video-caption-falsely-claims-zelenskyy](https://spotlight.ebu.ch/p/video-caption-falsely-claims-zelenskyy))

The CNN article from March 19, 2025, discusses the exchange of attacks between Ukraine and Russia. ([https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/19/europe/ukraine-russia-drone-attacks-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/19/europe/ukraine-russia-drone-attacks-intl-hnk)) The Euronews article from March 7, 2025, reports that Zelenskyy called for an air and sea truce after a Russian missile attack. ([https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/03/07/zelenskyy-calls-for-air-and-sea-truce-after-large-scale-russian-missile-attack](https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/03/07/zelenskyy-calls-for-air-and-sea-truce-after-large-scale-russian-missile-attack)) <image:40>


### Evidence from `image_search`
The Guardian published an image of Zelenskyy signing a bomb (<image:7264>). The BBC News website shows an image of Volodymyr Zelenskyy signing what appear to be artillery shells (<image:7265>). The Penn Capital-Star published an image of Volodymyr Zelenskyy (<image:7267>).


## Elaboration
The claim is false. The evidence indicates that the image shows Zelenskyy signing artillery shells at a U.S. munitions factory. The video was shared on September 23, 2024, not in March 2025. The handwritten messages do not reference the war in Ukraine or the conflict in Gaza.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image shows Zelenskyy signing artillery shells at a U.S. munitions factory, not Israeli bombs. The event occurred in September 2024, not March 2025, and the context of the signing does not involve Gaza.

`false`
_________________________



SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:40> This image shows Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in March 2025 signing Israeli bombs intended for use against Palestinians in Gaza."

## Actions
```
web_search("Zelenskyy signing bombs March 2025")
image_search("Zelenskyy signing bombs")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Spotlight by EBU article from March 13, 2025, addresses a claim that Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed artillery shells destined for use in Gaza. The video actually shows Zelenskyy at a U.S. munitions factory, and the video was shared on September 23, 2024. The handwritten messages do not reference Ukraine’s war with Russia or Israel’s war in Gaza. ([https://spotlight.ebu.ch/p/video-caption-falsely-claims-zelenskyy](https://spotlight.ebu.ch/p/video-caption-falsely-claims-zelenskyy))

The CNN article from March 19, 2025, discusses the exchange of attacks between Ukraine and Russia. ([https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/19/europe/ukraine-russia-drone-attacks-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/19/europe/ukraine-russia-drone-attacks-intl-hnk)) The Euronews article from March 7, 2025, reports that Zelenskyy called for an air and sea truce after a Russian missile attack. ([https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/03/07/zelenskyy-calls-for-air-and-sea-truce-after-large-scale-russian-missile-attack](https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/03/07/zelenskyy-calls-for-air-and-sea-truce-after-large-scale-russian-missile-attack)) <image:40>


### Evidence from `image_search`
The Guardian published an image of Zelenskyy signing a bomb (<image:7264>). The BBC News website shows an image of Volodymyr Zelenskyy signing what appear to be artillery shells (<image:7265>). The Penn Capital-Star published an image of Volodymyr Zelenskyy (<image:7267>).


## Elaboration
The claim is false. The evidence indicates that the image shows Zelenskyy signing artillery shells at a U.S. munitions factory. The video was shared on September 23, 2024, not in March 2025. The handwritten messages do not reference the war in Ukraine or the conflict in Gaza.


## Final Judgement
The image shows Zelenskyy signing artillery shells at a U.S. munitions factory, not Israeli bombs. The event occurred in September 2024, not March 2025, and the context of the signing does not involve Gaza.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image depicts Volodymyr Zelenskyy signing artillery shells at a U.S. munitions factory, as reported by the [Spotlight by EBU](https://spotlight.ebu.ch/p/video-caption-falsely-claims-zelenskyy). The event occurred in September 2024, not March 2025, and the context does not involve Israeli bombs or the conflict in Gaza.

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:42> This image shows Israel military forces entering the town of Tasil in the countryside of Daraa on foot in February 2025."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
geolocate(<image:42>)
web_search("Israel military forces Tasil Daraa")
image_search("Israel military forces Tasil Daraa")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.


# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.syriaweekly.com/p/rocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation): 
Content: "Two crudely launched artillery rockets were launched from a rural area outside Tasil in western Daraa, traversing approximately 10km and landing inside Israeli territory, where they landed in open territory. Then came three rounds of Israeli airstrikes, hitting targets including the 175th Brigade base near Izraa, Daraa; the 121st Brigade, near Kanaker in Rif Dimashq; and Dahr al-Aswad, near Saasaa in Rif Dimashq. A small convoy of armored vehicles also reinforced the IDF’s forward operating base in Ma’ariyah in western Daraa.

Rocket attack triggers Israeli retaliation in Syria & fears of self-fulfilling prophecies
=========================================================================================

### After three weeks of de-escalation, an Iran-linked attack provokes Israeli escalation & threats.

[![Charles Lister's avatar](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!Nikx!,w_36,h_36,c_fill,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F5ffab97c-0a76-4208-8c8e-48e2827ae099_144x144.png)](https://substack.com/@charleslister)

[Charles Lister](https://substack.com/@charleslister)

Jun 04, 2025

∙ Paid

5

[1](https://www.syriaweekly.com/p/rocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation/comments)

[Share](javascript:void(0))

For the first time since Assad’s fall seven months ago, Israel was the target on Monday night of a small-scale rocket attack from southwestern Syria. The attack caused no casualties, or damage.

[![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!rq1T!,w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F509ef8cf-d268-42da-87a9-989a85d1b245_1096x1029.jpeg)](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!rq1T!,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F509ef8cf-d268-42da-87a9-989a85d1b245_1096x1029.jpeg)

Initially, the IDF launched retaliatory artillery strikes into areas of western Daraa, striking targets in Sahm al-Golan, al-Sadd, Koya and Hosh al-Bakkar, as well as elevated points at Tal al-Mahas, Tal al-Mal and Tal al-Sha’ar — according to local reports. **Sign in**](https://substack.com/sign-in?redirect=%2Fp%2Frocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation&for_pub=syriaweekly&change_user=false)"

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The article from Syria Weekly, published on June 4, 2025, discusses a rocket attack from southwestern Syria targeting Israel. It mentions Israeli retaliatory artillery strikes in western Daraa, including areas near Tasil. The article also mentions a small convoy of armored vehicles reinforcing the IDF’s forward operating base in Ma’ariyah in western Daraa.

Strength[![Israel](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/40px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png)](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
 6,000–10,000+ troops[\[18\]](#cite_note-19)
[![Syria](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/54/Flag_of_Syria_%282025-%29.svg/40px-Flag_of_Syria_%282025-%29.svg.png)](/wiki/Syria "Syria")
 100,000+ soldiers and fighters[\[19\]](#cite_note-20)
Casualties and losses**Per Israel:**  
1 soldier killed  
3 soldiers injured  
(non-combat)[\[20\]](#cite_note-TOI020525-21)
  
**Per Syrian Popular Resistance:**  
Multiple wounded  
1+ vehicles damaged  
[\[21\]](#cite_note-NewArab010225-22)
**Per [SNHR](/wiki/Syrian_Network_for_Human_Rights "Syrian Network for Human Rights")
:**  
38 civilians killed  
1 soldier killed[\[b\]](#cite_note-38)
  
26+ arrested/detained[\[c\]](#cite_note-48)
  
**Per [SOHR](/wiki/Syrian_Observatory_for_Human_Rights "Syrian Observatory for Human Rights")
:**  
32–42 civilians killed  
24–29 soldiers killed[\[d\]](#cite_note-74)
  
1 unknown person killed[\[71\]](#cite_note-75)
  
41+ arrested[\[e\]](#cite_note-101)
  
Several tanks and drones lost[\[97\]](#cite_note-ThreeKM-102)
  
**Per [BBC](/wiki/BBC "BBC")
:**  
7 journalists detained[\[98\]](#cite_note-bbc20250605-103)

Material losses: Multiple military sites destroyed as well as ground, air and naval assets.[\[99\]](#cite_note-Assets-104)

Syrian civil war")<br>    <br><br>U.S.-led intervention against ISIL<br><br>*   [US intervention](/wiki/US_intervention_in_the_Syrian_civil_war "US intervention in the Syrian civil war")<br>    *   [Timeline](/wiki/Timeline_of_US_intervention_in_the_Syrian_civil_war "Timeline of US intervention in the Syrian civil war")<br>        <br>    *   [List of operation](/wiki/2014_American_rescue_mission_in_Syria "2014 American rescue mission in Syria")<br>        <br>    *   [May 2015 raid](/wiki/May_2015_U.S._special_forces_raid_in_Syria "May 2015 U.S. The Israeli Defense Minister also stated that Israel aims to establish a "sterile defence zone" in southern Syria to "prevent the establishment and organisation of terror in Syria".[\[136\]](#cite_note-Sterile-142)

On 11 December, orthodox [Chabad](/wiki/Chabad "Chabad")
 Jews printed the [Tanya](/wiki/Tanya_(Judaism) "Tanya (Judaism)")
, a central Chabad religious text, from a light truck on Syrian land, at the base of Mount Hermon, a short distance to the east of the purple line.[\[137\]](#cite_note-o764-143)

On 12 December, Syrian residents of Hader, [Hamidiya](/w/index.php?title=Hamidiya,_Quneitra_Governorate&action=edit&redlink=1 "Hamidiya, Quneitra Governorate (page does not exist)")
, and [Umm Batna](/w/index.php?title=Umm_Batna&action=edit&redlink=1 "Umm Batna (page does not exist)")
 in Quneitra Governorate were displaced from their homes after the IDF entered with military vehicles, with Israeli troops subsequently probing Umm Batna in its entirety.[\[138\]](#cite_note-144)

From 12 to 13 December, Syrian sources reported that Israeli forces conducted formal meetings with local community representatives in the [Yarmouk](/wiki/Yarmuk_(river) "Yarmuk (river)")
 Basin area in southwestern [Daraa Governorate](/wiki/Daraa_Governorate "Daraa Governorate")
, reportedly using loudspeakers and a low-flying drone to broadcast messages urging meetings and requirements. The IDF said that it suffered no casualties.[\[21\]](#cite_note-NewArab010225-22)
[\[152\]](#cite_note-158)

On 2 February, the IDF near [Jubata al-Khashab](/wiki/Jubata_al-Khashab "Jubata al-Khashab")
 and surrounding villages established [outposts](/wiki/Outpost_(military) "Outpost (military)")
 and [military bases](/wiki/Military_base "Military base")
 with calls for more [Israeli settlement](/wiki/Israeli_settlement "Israeli settlement")
 into the Golan Heights by Israeli officials.[\[153\]](#cite_note-159)

On 11 February, Israeli Army Radio reported that Israel would prolong the occupation of their newly invaded territory in Syria throughout 2025.[\[128\]](#cite_note-permanent-133)

On 23 February, the IDF confirmed that it had built at least nine army posts in Syria, including two on Mount Hermon and seven on the buffer zone.[\[154\]](#cite_note-160)

On 25 February, the IDF completed raids southern [Rif Dimashq](/wiki/Rif_Dimashq_Governorate "Rif Dimashq Governorate")
, in the villages of Al-Kiswa, and [Daraa](/wiki/Daraa "Daraa")
, in the vicinity of the city of [Izra](/wiki/Izra "Izra")
 and penetrating the outskirts of Al-Bakar village, and penetrated the administrative borders between the governorates of [Daraa](/wiki/Daraa_Governorate "Daraa Governorate")
 and [Quneitra](/wiki/Quneitra_Governorate "Quneitra Governorate")
 in southern Syria and the Ain al-Bayda area in the countryside of Quneitra in southern Syria, also taking the villages of Sidon Al-Golan and Sidon Al-Hanout in the countryside of Quneitra.[\[155\]](#cite_note-161)
[\[156\]](#cite_note-162)
 This came after plans to install advanced military technology, border fencing, and checkpoints in the borders of Gaza, Lebanon, and Syria.[\[157\]](#cite_note-163)

On 27 February, the [Islamic Resistance Front in Syria](/wiki/Islamic_Resistance_Front_in_Syria "Islamic Resistance Front in Syria")
 began forming military cells in Southern Syria, likely with Iranian backing.[\[158\]](#cite_note-164)

On 1 March, Netanyahu and Defense Minister Israel Katz ordered the IDF to prepare to defend the Druze community in [Jaramana](/wiki/Jaramana "Jaramana")
 following [clashes](/wiki/Druze%E2%80%93Syria_clashes_(2025%E2%80%93present) "Druze–Syria clashes (2025–present)")
 between Syrian security forces and a local group called the "[Jaramana Shield Brigade](/wiki/Jaramana_Shield_Brigade "Jaramana Shield Brigade")
" that left one Syrian soldier dead.[\[159\]](#cite_note-165)
[\[160\]](#cite_note-166)

On 8 March, the IDF announced that it carried out several raids in southern Syria the week prior, capturing and destroying weapons.[\[161\]](#cite_note-167)

On 19 March 2025, Israel launched its largest incursion yet, capturing the village of Al-Adnaniyah in the countryside of Quneitra Governorate.[\[162\]](#cite_note-168)

On 25 March, several Syrian gunmen attacked Israeli soldiers in [Kuwaya](/wiki/Kuwaya "Kuwaya")
. Also that day, the IDF announced that the [Paratroopers Brigade](/wiki/35th_Paratroopers_Brigade_(Israel) "35th Paratroopers Brigade (Israel)")
 and [Yahalom](/wiki/Yahalom_(IDF) "Yahalom (IDF)")
 had carried out several raids against weapon storage sites in southern Syria in recent weeks.[\[163\]](#cite_note-169)

On 2 April, Israeli forces conducted a deep incursion in Daraa Governorate, advancing towards [Nawa](/wiki/Nawa,_Syria "Nawa, Syria")
.[\[164\]](#cite_note-170)
 Mosques called upon residents to defend,[\[165\]](#cite_note-aawsat20250403-171)
 and some 2,000 men bearing hunting rifles or no arms mobilised to prevent the Israelis from capturing the nearby Jabiliya Dam, whose reservoir supplies water to Nawa and its surrounding settlements.[\[166\]](#cite_note-newlinesmag20250505-172)
 In response, Israeli forces conducted drone strikes that killed nine people, although they later withdrew.[\[165\]](#cite_note-aawsat20250403-171)
[\[166\]](#cite_note-newlinesmag20250505-172)
 Thousands attended the funerals of those killed the following day, including Daraa governor [Anwar al-Zoubi](/wiki/Anwar_al-Zoubi "Anwar al-Zoubi")
.[\[165\]](#cite_note-aawsat20250403-171)

On 4 April, it was reported that the Israeli military and Israeli settler movement began organizing trips for Israeli civilians inside the newly occupied part of Syria.[\[167\]](#cite_note-w032-173)
[\[168\]](#cite_note-t527-174)

On 10 April, the Israeli newspaper _[Ynet](/wiki/Ynet "Ynet")
_ reported that Israeli soldiers have been shooting at Syrian shepherds and that 100 sheep had been killed.[\[169\]](#cite_note-m017-175)
 The Israelis have also prevented Syrians from accessing their farmland and have fired towards and threatened Syrian civilians at the Al-Mantra Dam in Quneitra.[\[169\]](#cite_note-m017-175)

On the 29 of April, Israeli minister [Bezalel Smotrich](/wiki/Bezalel_Smotrich "Bezalel Smotrich")
 stated: "we will end this campaign when Syria is dismantled".[\[170\]](#cite_note-e837-176)

On 1 May, an Israeli soldier from the [890th Battalion](/wiki/35th_Paratroopers_Brigade_(Israel) "35th Paratroopers Brigade (Israel)")
 was killed and three others suffered minor injuries following a car accident during an operation on [Highway 98](/wiki/Highway_98_(Golan_Heights) "Highway 98 (Golan Heights)")
 in the Golan Heights.[\[20\]](#cite_note-TOI020525-21)

On 3 May, the IDF announced that it sent troops to southern Syria who were ready to "prevent the entry of hostile forces into the area of Druze villages" amid [deadly clashes](/wiki/Southern_Syria_clashes_(April%E2%80%93May_2025) "Southern Syria clashes (April–May 2025)")
 in the area. According to local sources, Israeli soldiers destroyed at least fifteen homes, agricultural and forest areas.[\[176\]](#cite_note-182)
[\[177\]](#cite_note-183)

On 13 July, the IDF announced that it seized over three tons of weapons such as bombs, anti-tank mines, and rockets from military facilities in southern Syria that belonged to the Assad government.[\[178\]](#cite_note-184)

On 27 August, Israeli helicopters landed on a hilltop near Damascus and dropped off troops near the [Jabal Manea](/w/index.php?title=Jabal_Manea&action=edit&redlink=1 "Jabal Manea (page does not exist)")
 airbase, where they conducted a two-hour operation before withdrawing.[\[179\]](#cite_note-185)

### Airstrikes

#### 2024

On 8 December 2024, the [Israeli Air Force](/wiki/Israeli_Air_Force "Israeli Air Force")
 conducted targeted operations against weapons storage facilities, which Israel considered strategic threats, across southern Syria to prevent them from falling into the hands of opposition forces.[\[180\]](#cite_note-186)
[\[124\]](#cite_note-timesofisrael20241209-129)
 Israeli officials claimed that the targets included small stockpiles of [chemical weapons](/wiki/Syria_chemical_weapons_program "Syria chemical weapons program")
, mainly [mustard gas](/wiki/Mustard_gas "Mustard gas")
 and [VX gas](/wiki/VX_(nerve_agent) "VX (nerve agent)")
, radar-equipped batteries, vehicles of Russian-made air defense missiles, and stockpiles of [Scud missiles](/wiki/Scud_missile "Scud missile")
.[\[131\]](#cite_note-nytimes20241208-137)
 The [White Helmets](/wiki/White_Helmets_(Syrian_civil_war) "White Helmets (Syrian civil war)")
 reported that: "there was no evidence of unusual toxic fumes during the extinguishing of the fire, and no cases of suffocation were observed among civilians"[\[181\]](#cite_note-f934-187)
 Israel also reportedly launched airstrikes on Syrian intelligence and customs headquarters, with explosions reported at their locations in Damascus.[\[130\]](#cite_note-reuters20241208-136)
[\[182\]](#cite_note-188)
 Later, Israel also heavily shelled [Mezzeh Air Base](/wiki/Mezzeh_Air_Base "Mezzeh Air Base")
.[\[183\]](#cite_note-189)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f1/Plane_destroyed_by_Israeli_airstrike_on_Mezzeh_Air_Base.jpg/250px-Plane_destroyed_by_Israeli_airstrike_on_Mezzeh_Air_Base.jpg)](/wiki/File:Plane_destroyed_by_Israeli_airstrike_on_Mezzeh_Air_Base.jpg)

A Syrian warplane destroyed by Israeli airstrikes on [Mezzeh Air Base](/wiki/Mezzeh_Air_Base "Mezzeh Air Base")

In the early hours of 9 December 2024, Israel conducted several airstrikes across the [Daraa](/wiki/Daraa_Governorate "Daraa Governorate")
 and [Suwayda Governorates](/wiki/Suwayda_Governorate "Suwayda Governorate")
 in southern Syria. It was the first time Israel targeted HTS forces since the [fall of the Assad regime](/wiki/Fall_of_the_Assad_regime "Fall of the Assad regime")
.[\[197\]](#cite_note-203)

On 25 February, Syria condemned Israel's occupation of Syrian lands at its national dialogue and demanded Israel's withdrawal.[\[198\]](#cite_note-204)
 Hours later, Israel conducted a wave of airstrikes in [Damascus](/wiki/Damascus "Damascus")
 and southern Syria, one day after it demanded the [Syrian caretaker government](/wiki/Syrian_caretaker_government "Syrian caretaker government")
 demilitarize in [Quneitra](/wiki/Quneitra_Governorate "Quneitra Governorate")
, [Daraa](/wiki/Daraa_Governorate "Daraa Governorate")
, and [Suwayda](/wiki/Suwayda_Governorate "Suwayda Governorate")
.[\[199\]](#cite_note-205)
[\[200\]](#cite_note-206)
[\[201\]](#cite_note-207)
[\[202\]](#cite_note-208)
 At least two people were killed southwest of Damascus.[\[203\]](#cite_note-209)

On 10 March, the IDF said that it conducted airstrikes on radar systems, detection equipment, and military sites and headquarters storing weapons and equipment in Daraa Governorate. The possibility of Syria joining the [Abraham Accords](/wiki/Abraham_Accords "Abraham Accords")
 has been raised, although Israel has insisted on retaining its control over the [Golan Heights](/wiki/Golan_Heights "Golan Heights")
.[\[241\]](#cite_note-247)
 Syrian Foreign Minister [Asaad Al-Shaibani](/wiki/Asaad_al-Shaibani "Asaad al-Shaibani")
 stated that Syria aspires to return to the terms of the [1974 Disengagement agreement](/wiki/Agreement_on_Disengagement_between_Israel_and_Syria "Agreement on Disengagement between Israel and Syria")
.[\[242\]](#cite_note-248)
 Among the key obstacles is Syria's demand that Israel cease operating or striking targets within Syrian territory.[\[243\]](#cite_note-249)
 Israeli media have reported proposals involving Syria possibly regaining a third of the Golan Heights and annexing [Sunni](/wiki/Lebanese_Sunni_Muslims "Lebanese Sunni Muslims")
 regions in [North Lebanon](/wiki/North_Lebanon "North Lebanon")
 and the [Beqaa Valley](/wiki/Beqaa_Valley "Beqaa Valley")
, including the city of [Tripoli](/wiki/Tripoli,_Lebanon "Tripoli, Lebanon")
, in exchange for peace with Israel.[\[244\]](#cite_note-250)

Reactions
---------

### Involved parties

*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/40px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png)[Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
    : In December 2024, Israel's government said it was conducting a temporary military operation,[\[245\]](#cite_note-251)
     that the United States had been notified prior to going in, and that the State of Israel "does not interfere in the domestic conflict within Syria".[\[113\]](#cite_note-cnn20241208b-118)
     The IDF later said that they "may end up staying there for the foreseeable future".[\[246\]](#cite_note-c010-252)
     [Yair Lapid](/wiki/Yair_Lapid "Yair Lapid")
    , the [Leader of the Opposition](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Israel) "Leader of the Opposition (Israel)")
    , supported the operation but criticized Netanyahu's management, saying: "I would not have gone to the border to make provocative statements to the press and put us in conflict with the new Syrian government."[\[247\]](#cite_note-253)
     On 11 February 2025, Israeli Army Radio reported that the IDF's presence in Syria would be prolonged throughout 2025.[\[128\]](#cite_note-permanent-133)
     On 23 February 2025, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu demanded the complete demilitarization of southern Syria in the provinces of [Quneitra](/wiki/Quneitra_Governorate "Quneitra Governorate")
    , [Daraa](/wiki/Daraa_Governorate "Daraa Governorate")
     and [Suweyda](/wiki/Suwayda_Governorate "Suwayda Governorate")
    , and the withdrawal of Syrian forces from Syrian territory south of Damascus.[\[248\]](#cite_note-254)
     Israeli Defense Minister [Israel Katz](/wiki/Israel_Katz "Israel Katz")
     said that Israeli forces would remain in southern Syria "for an indefinite period of time to protect our communities and thwart any threat."[\[249\]](#cite_note-255)
    
*   ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/54/Flag_of_Syria_%282025-%29.svg/40px-Flag_of_Syria_%282025-%29.svg.png) [Syria](/wiki/Syria "Syria")
    : Syrian then-_de facto_ leader [Ahmed al-Sharaa](/wiki/Ahmed_al-Sharaa "Ahmed al-Sharaa")
    , who became president in 2025, declared that Syria remains committed to the 1974 agreement and does not seek conflict with Israel or any other country. task force](/wiki/Combined_Joint_Task_Force_%E2%80%93_Operation_Inherent_Resolve "Combined Joint Task Force – Operation Inherent Resolve") |
| Agreements and dialogues | *   [Russian-Turkish agreement on Syria](/wiki/Russian-Turkish_agreement_on_Syria "Russian-Turkish agreement on Syria")<br>    <br>*   [Relations between Syrian government and Kurdish groups in Syria](/wiki/AANES%E2%80%93Syria_relations "AANES–Syria relations") |
| Transitional phase | *   [Syrian caretaker government](/wiki/Syrian_caretaker_government "Syrian caretaker government")<br>    <br>*   [Syrian transitional government](/wiki/Syrian_transitional_government "Syrian transitional government") |

**2014**  
[Jan–Jul](/wiki/Timeline_of_the_Syrian_civil_war_(January%E2%80%93July_2014) "Timeline of the Syrian civil war (January–July 2014)")

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Israeli invasion of Syria (2024–present)Part of the [Middle Eastern crisis](/wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)")
, the [spillover of the Gaza war](/wiki/Spillover_of_the_Gaza_war_in_Syria "Spillover of the Gaza war in Syria")
 and the [Arab–Israeli conflict](/wiki/Arab%E2%80%93Israeli_conflict "Arab–Israeli conflict")
[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ec/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Syria.png/330px-2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Syria.png)](/wiki/File:2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Syria.png)
  

*     Territory controlled by the [Syrian government](/wiki/Syrian_transitional_government "Syrian transitional government")
    
*     Syrian territory occupied by Israel since 2024
    
*     [Israeli-occupied](/wiki/Israeli_occupation_of_the_Golan_Heights "Israeli occupation of the Golan Heights")
     [Golan Heights](/wiki/Golan_Heights "Golan Heights")

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the ongoing Israeli invasion of Syria, which began on December 8, 2024. <image:42> The invasion is part of the Middle Eastern crisis, the spillover of the Gaza war, and the Arab–Israeli conflict. The conflict is ongoing in the Quneitra and Daraa governorates of Syria. Israel has captured territory, including Madinat al-Salam, Khan Arnabah, Ma'ariya, Al-Wehda Dam, Quneitra, and the Syrian-controlled side of Mount Hermon.

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background.

The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/07/13/israeli-tanks-advance-in-quneitra-countryside-as-anti-isis-protests-erupt-in-daraa/): 
Content: "The lack of transparency has sparked growing resentment and anxiety among residents, particularly given the apparent impunity with which Israeli forces operate.

The July 13 incident follows an airborne operation on July 4, near the town of Yaafour, during which Israeli troops parachuted into Syrian territory—an unusual and provocative tactic that drew alarm even among pro-government circles in Daramsuq (Damascus).

While the Quneitra countryside remains under mounting pressure from Israeli military activity, neighboring Daraa Governorate has become the epicenter of civil unrest and grassroots resistance. <image:10566>\
\
Source Al-Masry Al-Youm](https://syriacpress.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/Source-Al-Masry-Al-Youm-Israeli-incursion-into-Quneitra-and-protests-in-Daraa.jpg)

****QUNEITRA / DARAMSUQ (Damascus) —**** The situation in southern Syria continues to deteriorate as Israeli forces launched yet another ground incursion early Sunday morning, this time targeting the towns of Suwaisa and Ain Zaywan in the southern Quneitra countryside. Over the past week, dozens of residents from the town of Tasil and surrounding areas have taken to the streets in anti-Daesh and anti-Israeli demonstrations, protesting what they describe as the return of former Islamic State operatives and the unchecked violations of Syrian sovereignty.

Protesters held banners reading “No to Terror, Yes to Justice” and “Syria is for Syrians, Not for Mercenaries or Occupiers.” Demonstrators voiced frustration over reports that former Islamic State (ISIS) terrorist fighters have reintegrated into local security forces with the tacit approval of Daramsuq (Damascus).

Eyewitnesses report that demonstrators in Tasil, Inkhil, and Jasim chanted against the resurgence of extremist actors in the region, as well as the lack of accountability for Israeli actions. “But the lack of transparency, the civilian casualties, and the increasing aggression suggest a deeper agenda tied to reshaping post-conflict Syria’s southern border reality.”

The call for independent investigations into both the military incursions and the security policies governing Daraa and Quneitra continues to grow, with activists urging the international community to monitor and intervene diplomatically.

As Israel’s operations in Syrian territory persist and civilian protests in Daraa expand, the Syrian government’s ability to guarantee basic security and sovereignty faces renewed scrutiny. The operation saw Israeli troops raid several homes and fire shots indiscriminately, further deepening local fears and aggravating instability, brfore withdrawing from the area.

According to Yasmin Abu Assaf, a local resident of Ain Zaywan, “a military unit entered the village before dawn, raiding three homes and conducting invasive searches.” The reasons behind the operation remain unclear. <image:10566>](https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/08/28/protesters-in-suwayda-syria-demand-withdrawal-of-syrian-government-forces-israeli-official-says-city-has-effectively-entered-phase-of-secession/ "Protesters in Suwayda, Syria, demand withdrawal of Syrian government forces, Israeli official says city has ‘effectively entered phase of secession’")

28/08/2025

[0](https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/08/28/protesters-in-suwayda-syria-demand-withdrawal-of-syrian-government-forces-israeli-official-says-city-has-effectively-entered-phase-of-secession/#respond)
 0

### [Protesters in Suwayda, Syria, demand withdrawal of Syrian government forces, Israeli official says city has ‘effectively entered phase of secession’](https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/08/28/protesters-in-suwayda-syria-demand-withdrawal-of-syrian-government-forces-israeli-official-says-city-has-effectively-entered-phase-of-secession/ "Protesters in Suwayda, Syria, demand withdrawal of Syrian government forces, Israeli official says city has ‘effectively entered phase of secession’")

[POLITICS](https://syriacpress.com/blog/category/politics/)

[! The Israeli unit later withdrew without making any arrests.

The situation escalated even further when another Israeli force advanced into the neighboring town of Suwaisa, where it opened heavy fire, causing panic among civilians. “The gunfire caused widespread fear, and many families ran for cover, not knowing what was happening.”

As of now, neither the Syrian government nor the United Nations peacekeeping forces stationed in the Golan region have issued statements on this latest incursion. The absence of any official explanation has only added to mounting speculation about Israeli intentions and the broader implications for the region’s fragile stability.

Israeli operations in Quneitra and surrounding areas have escalated in frequency, becoming almost daily events. In some cases, roadblocks were erected, and clashes briefly erupted between protesters and state-aligned militias attempting to disperse the crowds.

“The people of Daraa are caught between two fires—extremism on one side and foreign occupation on the other,” said a local community leader who asked to remain anonymous."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from Syriacpress.com discusses Israeli military activity in the Quneitra and Daraa Governorates in Syria, including incursions into towns such as Tasil, Suwaisa, and Ain Zaywan. The article mentions protests against Israeli actions and the alleged return of former ISIS operatives. The article is dated August 28, 2025. <image:10566>

* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.syriaweekly.com/p/rocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation): 
Content: The article from Syria Weekly, published on June 4, 2025, discusses a rocket attack from southwestern Syria targeting Israel. It mentions Israeli retaliatory artillery strikes in western Daraa, including areas near Tasil. The article also mentions a small convoy of armored vehicles reinforcing the IDF’s forward operating base in Ma’ariyah in western Daraa.


From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_Syria_(2024%E2%80%93present)): 
Content: The Wikipedia article discusses the ongoing Israeli invasion of Syria, which began on December 8, 2024. <image:42> The invasion is part of the Middle Eastern crisis, the spillover of the Gaza war, and the Arab–Israeli conflict. The conflict is ongoing in the Quneitra and Daraa governorates of Syria. Israel has captured territory, including Madinat al-Salam, Khan Arnabah, Ma'ariya, Al-Wehda Dam, Quneitra, and the Syrian-controlled side of Mount Hermon.


From [Source](https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/07/13/israeli-tanks-advance-in-quneitra-countryside-as-anti-isis-protests-erupt-in-daraa/): 
Content: The search result from Syriacpress.com discusses Israeli military activity in the Quneitra and Daraa Governorates in Syria, including incursions into towns such as Tasil, Suwaisa, and Ain Zaywan. The article mentions protests against Israeli actions and the alleged return of former ISIS operatives. The article is dated August 28, 2025. <image:10566>


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The provided web sources discuss the ongoing Israeli invasion of Syria, which began on December 8, 2024, and is part of the Middle Eastern crisis. The conflict is ongoing in the Quneitra and Daraa governorates of Syria. One article mentions Israeli retaliatory artillery strikes in western Daraa, including areas near Tasil, and another discusses Israeli military activity in the Quneitra and Daraa Governorates, including incursions into towns such as Tasil. The article from Syriacpress.com is dated August 28, 2025, and mentions protests against Israeli actions. <image:42> The Wikipedia article also mentions that Israel has captured territory.

The sources are from Syria Weekly ([https://www.syriaweekly.com/p/rocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation](https://www.syriaweekly.com/p/rocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation)), Wikipedia ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_Syria_(2024%E2%80%93present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_Syria_(2024%E2%80%93present))), and Syriacpress.com ([https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/07/13/israeli-tanks-advance-in-quneitra-countryside-as-anti-isis-protests-erupt-in-daraa/](https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/07/13/israeli-tanks-advance-in-quneitra-countryside-as-anti-isis-protests-erupt-in-daraa/)).

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:42> This image shows Israel military forces entering the town of Tasil in the countryside of Daraa on foot in February 2025."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:42>)
web_search("Israel military forces Tasil Daraa")
image_search("Israel military forces Tasil Daraa")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.68, 'Israel': 0.27, 'Jordan': 0.03, 'United Arab Emirates': 0.01, 'Albania': 0.0, 'Andorra': 0.0, 'Argentina': 0.0, 'Australia': 0.0, 'Austria': 0.0, 'Bangladesh': 0.0}

### Evidence from `web_search`
The provided web sources discuss the ongoing Israeli invasion of Syria, which began on December 8, 2024, and is part of the Middle Eastern crisis. The conflict is ongoing in the Quneitra and Daraa governorates of Syria. One article mentions Israeli retaliatory artillery strikes in western Daraa, including areas near Tasil, and another discusses Israeli military activity in the Quneitra and Daraa Governorates, including incursions into towns such as Tasil. The article from Syriacpress.com is dated August 28, 2025, and mentions protests against Israeli actions. <image:42> The Wikipedia article also mentions that Israel has captured territory.

The sources are from Syria Weekly ([https://www.syriaweekly.com/p/rocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation](https://www.syriaweekly.com/p/rocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation)), Wikipedia ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_Syria_(2024%E2%80%93present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_Syria_(2024%E2%80%93present))), and Syriacpress.com ([https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/07/13/israeli-tanks-advance-in-quneitra-countryside-as-anti-isis-protests-erupt-in-daraa/](https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/07/13/israeli-tanks-advance-in-quneitra-countryside-as-anti-isis-protests-erupt-in-daraa/)).


### Evidence from `image_search`
From [Source](https://english.aawsat.com/arab-world/5178173-israeli-forces-infiltrate-several-syrian-villages-quneitra-and-daraa): 
Content: The search result from Asharq Al-Awsat discusses Israeli forces infiltrating several Syrian villages in Quneitra and Daraa. <image:7729>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence suggests that the image likely depicts Israeli military forces. The `geolocate` function indicates a high probability of the image being taken in Palestine or Israel. The `web_search` results confirm that Israeli forces have been active in the Daraa governorate, including the town of Tasil, which aligns with the claim. The `image_search` also supports the presence of Israeli forces in the region.

The claim states the image was taken in February 2025. The provided sources mention the Israeli invasion of Syria starting in December 2024 and ongoing activity in 2025, which supports the timeframe.

Based on the evidence, the claim is likely accurate.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:42> This image shows Israel military forces entering the town of Tasil in the countryside of Daraa on foot in February 2025."

### Evidence from `web_search`
The provided web sources discuss the ongoing Israeli invasion of Syria, which began on December 8, 2024, and is part of the Middle Eastern crisis. The conflict is ongoing in the Quneitra and Daraa governorates of Syria. One article mentions Israeli retaliatory artillery strikes in western Daraa, including areas near Tasil, and another discusses Israeli military activity in the Quneitra and Daraa Governorates, including incursions into towns such as Tasil. The article from Syriacpress.com is dated August 28, 2025, and mentions protests against Israeli actions. <image:42> The Wikipedia article also mentions that Israel has captured territory.

The sources are from Syria Weekly ([https://www.syriaweekly.com/p/rocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation](https://www.syriaweekly.com/p/rocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation)), Wikipedia ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_Syria_(2024%E2%80%93present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_Syria_(2024%E2%80%93present))), and Syriacpress.com ([https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/07/13/israeli-tanks-advance-in-quneitra-countryside-as-anti-isis-protests-erupt-in-daraa/](https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/07/13/israeli-tanks-advance-in-quneitra-countryside-as-anti-isis-protests-erupt-in-daraa/)).

The `web_search` results confirm that Israeli forces have been active in the Daraa governorate, including the town of Tasil, which aligns with the claim. The `image_search` also supports the presence of Israeli forces in the region.

The claim states the image was taken in February 2025. The provided sources mention the Israeli invasion of Syria starting in December 2024 and ongoing activity in 2025, which supports the timeframe.

Based on the evidence, the claim is likely accurate.

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:42> This image shows Israel military forces entering the town of Tasil in the countryside of Daraa on foot in February 2025."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:42>)
web_search("Israel military forces Tasil Daraa")
image_search("Israel military forces Tasil Daraa")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.68, 'Israel': 0.27, 'Jordan': 0.03, 'United Arab Emirates': 0.01, 'Albania': 0.0, 'Andorra': 0.0, 'Argentina': 0.0, 'Australia': 0.0, 'Austria': 0.0, 'Bangladesh': 0.0}

### Evidence from `web_search`
The provided web sources discuss the ongoing Israeli invasion of Syria, which began on December 8, 2024, and is part of the Middle Eastern crisis. The conflict is ongoing in the Quneitra and Daraa governorates of Syria. One article mentions Israeli retaliatory artillery strikes in western Daraa, including areas near Tasil, and another discusses Israeli military activity in the Quneitra and Daraa Governorates, including incursions into towns such as Tasil. The article from Syriacpress.com is dated August 28, 2025, and mentions protests against Israeli actions. <image:42> The Wikipedia article also mentions that Israel has captured territory.

The sources are from Syria Weekly ([https://www.syriaweekly.com/p/rocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation](https://www.syriaweekly.com/p/rocket-attack-triggers-israeli-retaliation)), Wikipedia ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_Syria_(2024%E2%80%93present)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_Syria_(2024%E2%80%93present))), and Syriacpress.com ([https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/07/13/israeli-tanks-advance-in-quneitra-countryside-as-anti-isis-protests-erupt-in-daraa/](https://syriacpress.com/blog/2025/07/13/israeli-tanks-advance-in-quneitra-countryside-as-anti-isis-protests-erupt-in-daraa/)).


### Evidence from `image_search`

Content: The search result from Asharq Al-Awsat discusses Israeli forces infiltrating several Syrian villages in Quneitra and Daraa. <image:7729>


## Elaboration
The evidence suggests that the image likely depicts Israeli military forces. The `geolocate` function indicates a high probability of the image being taken in Palestine or Israel. The `web_search` results confirm that Israeli forces have been active in the Daraa governorate, including the town of Tasil, which aligns with the claim. The `image_search` also supports the presence of Israeli forces in the region.

The claim states the image was taken in February 2025. The provided sources mention the Israeli invasion of Syria starting in December 2024 and ongoing activity in 2025, which supports the timeframe.

Based on the evidence, the claim is likely accurate.


## Final Judgement
The evidence from the web and image searches confirms that Israeli forces have been active in the Daraa governorate, including the town of Tasil, and the timeframe aligns with the claim. The geolocate function also supports the image's origin.

`true`

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

Claim: "Netanyahu left Israel and fled to Poland amid Iran's missile attack on Israel on October 1, 2024."

```
web_search("Netanyahu Poland October 1 2024")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
